Ella realiza esta actividad hace 16 años, Consuelo empezó a vender estos tipos de productos por lo que su esposo estaba enfermo con problemas de salud muy serios, y necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia, por lo que decidió salir a las calles en busca del pan de cada día para ofrecerlo a su familia, y así con el paso del tiempo logro aumentar en productos y obtener muchos clientes. En un futuro le gustaría mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que es a pesar de vivir en un lugar muy humilde le gustaría realizarle ciertas remodelaciones. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de nuevos productos, pinturas de labios, cremas y colonias.
texts.en:
Consuelo García B. is 53 years old and has a business selling cosmetics. She began selling this type of products sixteen years ago when her husband was seriously ill and her family needed more income. She decided to seek her daily bread by selling things on the street, and as time passed she was able to expand the products she offered and attract many customers.

In the future, Consuelo would like to improve her family's living conditions, since it is difficult to live in such a humble home and she would like to do some remodeling.

Consuelo will use this loan as working capital to purchase new products, including lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora GUILLERMINA G. S. , tiene 72 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo , departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL PROGRESO.
La empresaria es analfabeta; refiere que es de Salpo (sierra Liberteña) y desde pequeña se dedico al campo y cuidado de los animales.
Proviene de una familia muy humilde motivo por el cual tuvo que trabajar desde los 5 años de edad y sus padres no le dieron educación.
La socia es casada  y tiene 4 hijos todos mayores, quienes la apoyan económicamente y también la ayudan cuando se encuentra enferma. 

GULLERMINA se dedica a  la venta de productos alimenticios en la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
Compra los productos al por mayor como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, verduras, golosinas, gaseosas, cerveza, etc.

El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios la por mayor para así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de mas productos alimenticios al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite; así como también comprará vitrinas y andamios que necesita para su tienda.
LA Empresaria sueña con aumentar sus productos y poder así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora GUILLERMINA G. S. is 72 years old and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank MUJERES AL PROGRESO. This businesswoman is illiterate. She recounts that she is from Salpo (Liberteña mountains), and ever since she was young she has worked in the countryside caring for animals. She comes from a family of very humble circumstances, and for this reason she had to work since she was 5 years old so her parents were not able to give her an education. She is married, and has 4 grown children who provide her with some economic support and also help her when she is ill. Guillermina is engaged in the business of selling food products in a grocery store that she has in her house. She buys products wholesale such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, vegetables, candy, soft drinks, beer, etc. Her first loan of 300 nuevos soles was invested in the purchase of wholesale food products so that she could obtain better earnings. This loan of 800 nuevos soles will be used to purchase more wholesale food products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oil, as well as to purchase glass display cases and new shelving that she needs for her store. She dreams of increasing her products and thereby increasing her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products such as rice, sugar, noodles and cooking oil, and also to buy glass display cases and shelving

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel H. sells electronic parts such as switchboard lamp holders, starters, bulbs and electrical cables. He also repairs electrical appliances in Elmina. Daniel has received a senior-high education. He is married and has three children. Daniel has been selling electronic parts since 1999. He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. 

His loan will be used to buy more electronic parts for sale and also for his repair works. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more electronic parts for sale and also for his repair works.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: compra de mas cajas de cerveza y también empezará a vender gaseosas.

loans.name: Isabelle

texts.fr: H. Isabelle est née en 1974 au Bénin.  Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Isabelle n'a jamais fréquenté. Isabelle  produit et vend des amuses gueule (fait à base de farine de blé, sucre, lait, huile végétale, etc.) à de nombreux clients à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. A côté de cela, Isabelle a ajouté à son activité, la vente de boissons (bières et sucreries). Isabelle achète tous ces produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie du Bénin. Isabelle est à son deuxième crédit et sollicite un troisième crédit pour s'approvisionner et produire davantage les amuses gueule en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Achat de farine de blé et huile végétale

loans.name: Jacinta Mercedes

texts.es: Jacinta Mercedes Hernández R. tiene 44 años, es madre casada y junto a su pareja tienen 2 hijos a su cargo que estudian en colegios públicos. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre ha sido una mujer muy luchadora y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Anteriormente ella tenía un trabajo estable y podía generar los ingresos necesarios en su familia, pero lamentablemente hubo recorte de personal y fue despedida lo que la motivo a establecer su propio negocio.   Por lo que ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será invertido en la compa de granos básicos, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas y otros productos. El deseo de Jacinta es seguir creciendo con su negocio, y así poco a poco obtener más clientes para su negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: La señora María Magdalena es pensionada de una clínica médica y es viuda, ella vive solita ya que sus hijos todos están casados. Ella esta tramitando este crédito ya que desea impermeabilizar el techo de su vivienda, porque se acerca la temporada de lluvias y su techo esta dañado.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a widow who lives alone since her children are all married. She is retired from her job in a medical clinic. She is seeking a loan to fix the roof of her house, as the rainy season is approaching and the roof is damaged.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproofing the roof of her home

loans.name: Ayoyoé

texts.fr: A. Ayoyoé est née  vers 1949 à Ganvié, village lacustre situé au Sud du Bénin. Mariée et mère de trois enfants,  Ayoyoé n'a jamais fréquenté, et fut initiée très jeune à la vente de poissons frais et fumés qui est la principale activité de la région. Ayoyoé a continué avec la même activité jusqu’à ce jour.  Ayoyoé s'approvisionne en poissons dans les poissonneries de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ayoyoé fume ces poissons avant de les vendre à ses clients. Ayoyoé avait déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Ayoyoé sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Ayoyoé A. was born around 1949 in Ganvié, a lakeside village in southern Benin. She is married and the mother of three children. Ayoyoé, who never attended school, was a very young girl when she learnt the trade of selling fresh and smoked fish, the main economic activity in the region. She has always been active in this trade. Ayoyoé gets her supply in fish shops in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She smokes the fish and then sells them to her customers.

Ayoyoé had already two loans with Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Now, faced with an ever increasing demand from her clientele, she came to Alidé and applied for a third loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mónica De María

texts.es:
Mónica de María R. A. es una joven señora de 29 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos uno de cuatro años y otro de apenas 7 meses de edad en una comunidad llamada El Saíno de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos años generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios, lo que ayuda a mitigar el efecto de inmigración.

Mónica dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a las labores del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos ya que estos están muy pequeños;también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa para así ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero comenta que hace poco tuvo la idea de crear una heladería, con la cual espera generar más ingresos y mejorar el nivel económico en su vida y en la de su familia. Ella comenta que al tener el negocio en su propia casa no tiene que dejar a sus niños y así ella los puede criar y estar al pendiente de ellos.

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢685.000(seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar mercadería que pueda vender y así iniciar su negocio. Específicamente comprará recipientes con helados, golosinas, conos, barquillos entre otros implementos necesarios para asegurar el éxito de su negocio.

Mónica es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Luz del Futuro Saino, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su quinto   préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Mónica de María R. A. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and her two children (one four years old, the other barely seven months) in the El Saíno de Pital community in Alajuela province. The main economic activities in her area are cattle farming and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of pineapples for export to international markets. For this reason, the community has been developing over the last few years and there is an increased demand for products and services as a result of increased immigration to the area.

Mónica spends most of her time taking care of her home and children, since they are still very young. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she also has a small business selling clothing, but she has recently decided to start an ice cream parlor which she hopes will generate more income and improve her family's economic situation. She mentions that having a business in her home means that she can be around to take care of her children.

Mónica currently needs a loan of ¢685.000 (US $1200) to purchase merchandise to begin her business. Specifically, she will purchase containers of ice cream, sweets, cones, wafers, and other items needed to ensure the success of her business.

Mónica is a member of the “Luz del Futuro Saino” Community Bank, one of the 100 member groups of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fifth loan and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She also mentions that thanks to this type of organization and the way it facilitates loans she is able to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and merchandise for an ice cream parlor

loans.name: Las 3 Estrellas  De Slt Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal denominado  LAS 3 ESTRELLAS DE S. L. T., está conformado por doce  señoras que en su mayoría radican en la Zona Alto Santa Rosa, zona de gente humilde en la ciudad; la característica principal de sus casas, es que son de adobe en gran parte de ellas y tienen solo una planta, algunas de ellas están en alquiler. La directiva está conformada por la Giovanna, Elizabeth y Ernestina; las componentes del banco se dedican a la venta de víveres, comida, Cds, ropa nueva y usada, verduras; otras se dedican a la atención de pastelería, confección de mantas, etc. El mercado es muy competitivo en estos rubros, pero los años de experiencia con los que cuentan les ayuda a poder anticiparse a diferentes situaciones que se puedan suscitar. Ellas necesitan el crédito para realizar compras de materia prima y están muy animadas por trabajar con Agrocapital. Este grupo está emprendiendo su Cuarto ciclo, la mayoría de ellas ya se conocen entre sí y cuentan con experiencia puesto que participaron durante el primer ciclo, es un grupo de personas muy alegres responsables amistosas y solidarias.
texts.en:
The community bank Las 3 Estrellas de S.L.T. (The 3 Stars of S.L.T.) is made up of twelve ladies, the majority of whom live in the Alto Santa Rosa region, a poorer area of the city. The main characteristic of their homes is that they are made of adobe and most of them only have one floor. Some of their houses are rented.

The leaders of the group are Giovanna, Elizabeth, and Ernestina, and the group members make a living selling provisions, food, CDs, new and used clothing, and vegetables. Others work in bakeries, making blankets, etc. The market is very competitive in these areas, but their many years of experience help them be able to stay ahead when different situations occur.

They need this loan to buy raw materials and they are very excited to work with Agrocapital. This group is beginning its fourth loan cycle; the majority of them already know one another and can count on their experience since they have been together since the first loan. It is a group of very happy, responsible, friendly, and supportive people.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander B. sells fridges, television set and amplifiers etc at Elmina.  Alexander has received senior high education.  He is married and has four children His wife is a trader. Alexander has been selling fridges and so on since 2003. He is responsible for paying of school fees and bills. His loan will be used to buy more fridges and amplifiers to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save and purchase a piece of land.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more fridges and amplifiers to sell.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
A la vivienda del la señora Ana Patricia Q. le está haciendo falta el vitropiso en la sala y cocina. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
La señora  Ana Patricia  va hacer madre soltera,  pronta tendrá a su primer hijo y desea que tenga una mejor casa donde pueda vivir y darle le seguridad.
Ella planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos de su trabaja como encargada de una tienda departamental.
Ana Patricia Q. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntualmente.

loans.use: Colocación de vitropiso en la sala y cocina

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora tiene 42 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Tras ocuparse a la siembra de café por muchos años, ahora Dora optó en dedicarse a la venta de combustibles, debido a la ubicación estratégica de su casa, pues es una zona muy concurrida, por ser la carretera principal de la selva central; mientras que su esposo se sigue dedicando a las labores agrícolas. Hace pocos meses inicio la venta de combustibles con un cilindro de petróleo y ahora ya cuenta con tres, por ello tienen anhelos de incrementar su negocio, ya que viene obteniendo buenas ganancias, atendiendo 16 horas al día. De ese modo logra cubrir la alimentación y educación de sus hijos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y durante este periodo, la han nombrado la tesorera de su banco comunal debido a su carácter severo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en el incremento de dos más cilindros de petróleo.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 57 años, es viuda, tiene 7 hijos y vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia. Tras la muerte de su esposo, añadió a su labor diaria de pastear sus vacas y carneros el cultivo de papas y arvejas como lo hacía su esposo. Ahora Elsa, en compañía de sus dos menores hijos, se dedican a la siembra y cosecha de sus productos, los cuales comercializa en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad. Terminada tal labor, retoma la atención y el cuidado de sus animales, ya que  Elsa, como mujer precavida no se confía sólo de la agricultura, por ello trata de mantener sus dos actividades, aunque lo que más le gusta es pastar sus animales porque le es rentable todo el tiempo, mientras que son sus cultivos ve las ganancias después de la cosecha.
Este es su octavo crédito con MFP y en sus anteriores créditos nunca ha dejado de pagar alguna cuota pese que tuvo dificultades tras la muerte de su esposo. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old, is widowed, and has 7 children. She lives with two of them in her own home. After the death of her husband she has added to her daily work of grazing her cows and goats, the cultivation of potatoes and peas as her husband used to do. Now Elsa, in the company of her two youngest children, works planting and harvesting her produce which she sells at the whole-sale market in the city. After said work, she goes back to tending and caring for her animals. Because Elsa is a cautious woman, she doesn’t rely completely on agriculture and instead tries to maintain both her endeavors. Even so, she prefers grazing her animals because all of her time is income producing, whereas with crops she sees the profit only after the harvest.

This is her eighth loan with MFP and in her previous loans she has never missed a payment in spite of the fact that she had some difficulties after the death of her husband. The money she is requesting now is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic A. sells locally made sound speakers at Elmina.  Dominic has received senior high education.  He is married and has four children His wife is a seamstress. Dominic has been selling locally made speakers since 1999. He is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. His loan will be used to buy more coils and wood and other materials for his work for sale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to build a house.

loans.use: His loan will be used to buy more coils and wood and other materials for his work for sale.

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: Silvia Esperanza García F. tiene 50 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000 por lo que su record crediticio es muy bueno.  Es una mujer casada y con su esposo tiene 1 hijo que está a su cargo. La actividad económica de Doña Silvia es una pulpería. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Los problemas que ha enfrentado Silvia son de salud ya que debido a su edad es muy difícil tener la agilidad para servir a sus clientes, pero esto no le impide el seguir adelante. siempre se ha caracterizado por tener un gran carisma con sus clientes. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, pan, verduras entre otras cosas útiles para el hogar. Su deseo es mejorar su salud para continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Kouatonou

texts.fr: Née vers 1979 au Bénin, A. Kouatonou est originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre situé au Sud du Bénin. Kouatonou n'a jamais été à l'école ni appris un métier. Mariée et mère de trois enfants, elle exerce comme activité la vente de poissons congelés. Kouatonou achète les poissons frais qu’elle conserve et les revend aux vendeuses de poissons fumés. Pour accroître le niveau de son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Kouatonou sollicite un prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kouatonou A., born around 1979 in Benin, is from Ganvié, a lakeside village in southern Benin. She never attended school nor learnt a trade. She is married and the mother of three children. Kouatonou sells frozen fish. She buys fresh fish, deep-freezes them and then sells them to traders of smoked fish. To bolster her business and satisfy the ever increasing demand from her clientele, she applies to Alidé for a loan.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, es una mujer de un agradable carácter, tiene 39 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus 4 hijos. Desde pequeña aprendió con sus padres el cultivo de kion, piñas y plátanos, de los cuales el más rentable y de menor inversión es el kion, por ello es que con su esposo se han avocado más a este cultivo. Para la venta, cuentan con una vecina de su pueblo que es comerciante mayorista, a quien le venden toda su cosecha. La única dificultad es el transporte de los sacos desde su chacra hasta el pueblo, pues es una hora en carro, en una zona de difícil acceso y que en los tiempos de lluvias se empeora el traslado; pese a ello, María sigue sembrando en estas chacras porque son su única fuente de ingresos económicos.

Este es su 2do crédito con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado fue tesorera de su banco comunal, pero para este prestamos cedió esta responsabilidad a otra socia. Este dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de kion.
texts.en:
María is a woman with a pleasant disposition. She is 39 years old and lives with her partner, who is the father of their 4 children. Since childhood, María learned from her parents how to cultivate ginger, pineapples, and bananas. Of these crops, the one that is most profitable and requires less investment is ginger. Her husband also grows avocados. María has a neighbor who is a wholesaler and sells her entire harvest for her. Her only difficulty is transporting the bags of produce from her farm into town, since the trip takes an hour by car and can be more difficult when it rains. Despite these challenges, María continues to farm because it is her only source of income.

This is her second loan with MFP. During the previous loan cycle, she served as Communal Bank treasurer but she has handed that responsibility to another member. With the money she requested, María will buy chemical fertilizers for her ginger crop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 37 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en la casa de su madre. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de papas, arvejas, maíz y habas. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para dedicarle el mayor tiempo a sus cultivos, puesto que gracias a sus cuidados sus siembras le dan bueno resultados, sobre todo las arvejas que no necesitan de mucha inversión y de las cuales cosecha hasta tres veces. 

Después de recolectar sus productos los lleva al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los vende al mejor postor, terminando su venta en menos de 20 minutos. Luego regresa muy contenta a su casa por las ventas realizadas y con esas ganancias compra los comestibles para su hogar, para todo el mes, ya que ella sola mantiene a su madre anciana y a su hijo estudiante.

Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y durantes los anteriores ciclos de préstamos demostró puntualidad; asimismo, para éste, renueva su compromiso. María también está muy satisfecha porque en su banco comunal se les incentiva al ahorro. Con el dinero del crédito piensa comprar fertilizantes químicos y una bolsa de arvejas para sembrar.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: O. Honorine est née le 01 Décembre 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée, Honorine est mère d’un enfant. Honorine a abandonné très tôt les études pour diverses raisons et s'est lancée dans le commerce de divers (produits de toilettes, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, tomates, piments, etc.). Honorine possède une grande baraque où elle vend ces divers articles. Honorine achète la plupart de ses produits à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. C'est dans l'intention de renforcer son activité en vue de mieux satisfaire ses clients, que Honorine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Honorine O. was born on December 1, 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married and has one child. She quit school very early for various reasons and began selling assorted products (toiletries, pasta, canned goods, tomatoes, peppers, etc.). Honorine owns a large stand where she sells these goods. Honorine buys most of her products in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She is requesting a loan through Alidé to bolster her business and meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y por el momento vive en la casa de sus suegros junto a su esposo.
Durante todos los años que se ha dedicado a la agricultura sus plátanos y cítricos no han superando las ganancias que le brinda al café; por ello, para esta década alquiló chacras de tierras fértiles en zonas netamente cafetaleras. Norma se siente muy dichosa de vivir en la selva central peruana por la fertilidad de las tierras y mientras espera los dos o tres años para la cosecha del café se dedica a la siembra de plátanos y frutos cítricos, pues así mantiene estable la economía de su hogar. Por ello Norma y su esposo se sienten muy contentos de dedicarse a sus chacras y tiene el anhelo de obtener buenas ganancias que les permita adquirir sus propios  terrenos de cultivo, pues por el momento siembran en los de su suegro.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y en el ciclo anterior demostró ser puntual en sus pagos. Asimismo está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y más plantas cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Norma is 35 years old and the mother of 2 children. At the moment, she and her husband live in the house of her in-laws.

Throughout her life, Norma has been involved in growing bananas and citrus fruits. However, the income from these crops does not exceed the profits that can be made from coffee. For this reason, she decided to rent a field of rich farmland in an area known for its pristine coffee plantations. Norma feels very lucky to live in the central Peruvian jungle where the soil is fertile. While she waits 2 to 3 years for her coffee crop to mature, she continues to cultivate bananas and citrus fruits because it provides a stable income for her household. Norma and her husband are very happy with their plantings and look forward to generating good earnings so that they can buy their own farmland. They are currently using her father-in-law’s field.

This is Norma’s second loan with MFP. The payments from her previous loan were made on time. She is very happy to be part of her Communal Bank. The money she requested will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers and more coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & coffee plants

loans.name: Jones

texts.en: Jones M. sells fresh fish in Elmina.  ones has received a senior high education.  He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. Jones has been selling fresh fish since 1999. He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to buy gallons of oil for his fishing boat. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy gallons of oil for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Régina

texts.fr: Née vers 1950 à Ouidah ville historique du Bénin, T. Régina habite le quartier Vodjè à Cotonou. Mariée et mère de sept enfants tous scolarisés, Régina s’est lancée dans le commerce depuis plus de vingt ans. Au départ, Régina vendait de la nourriture (igname frite, riz et haricot). Mais depuis près de trois ans, Régina vend divers articles (conserves de diverses sortes, pâtes alimentaires, savons, huile végétale, biscuits, lait, etc.) à son domicile à Vodjè. Régina achète ses divers articles à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin. Régina a bien remboursé les quatre crédits précédents. Pour renforcer son étalage et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle devenue nombreuse, Régina sollicite un cinquième prêt à ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de conserves, de pâtes alimentaires, de savons, d'huile végétale, de papier hygiénique, et de biscuits

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo iglesia está conformado por Darling R. C., Gilmar Estela R. Murillo, Claudia Ivania H. y Néstor José C.. La coordinadora del grupo es Darling R. de 34 años, ella hace dos años que vende frutas y verduras en su casa. Con este pequeño negocio ha logrado impulsar a sus tres pequeños hijos en edad escolar y espera seguir trabajando en esto.

Gilma Estela R. de 41 años vende comida, Claudia H. hace seis años que trabaja como costurera y Néstor C. de 48 años  tiene una verdulería ubicada por la Iglesia de su barrio. Ellos desean poder superarse y prosperar para ello trabajaran arduamente y decididos a realizar su meta.

loans.use: comprar naranjas, limones, piña, melon, ayote, chayote, chilote, papa, yuca...etc

loans.name: Cruceñas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Cruceñas" están representadas por la señora Ericka Roxana y conformada por 12 miembros D. señoras que viven por la zona D. la pampa D. la isla, se conocen ya desD. hace muchos años todas tienen diferentes tipos D. negocios tales como vender cosméticos, algunas venden comida en el barrio tienen pequeñas pensiones, otras venden ropa D. forma ambulante debido a que la competencia es muy dura en estos días las señoras utilizan el dinero que se les presta para poder ampliar el stock D. productos que tienen y también para probar incursionar en otro tipo D. negocios paralelo al que ya tienen y así generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias van cumpliendo ya su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas D. sacar adelante a su familia y poderles brindar una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The Cruceñas Community Bank is represented by Mrs. Ericka Roxana and maD. up of 12 women who live on the plains of the island. They know one another and have had different types of businesses for many years, such as selling cosmetics, some who sell food in the neighborhood who have small boarding houses, and others sell clothing on the street due to the fierce competition these days.

The women use their loan money to increase the quantity of products they have and also to try new business ventures alongsiD. the ones they already have in order to earn more money to support their families. The members are now completing their second loan and have demonstrated punctuality and a will to help their families get ahead and give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Solano Group

texts.es:
Hortencia Leonor S. V., Darling de los Ángeles F. y Ulises Fernando M. conforman el grupo S.. Ellos son provenientes del reparto Martín Castellón de Nindiri. 

S. V. de 24 años es la coordinadora del grupo. El negocio de ella consiste en la venta de comida a domicilio, trabaja haciendo entrega de comida casera a los trabajadores de algunas empresas del lugar.  Darling F. desde hace nueve años vende tortillas y Ulises M. distribuye huevos. 

Ellos necesitan el préstamo para lograr que su negocio prospere y brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: para comprar granos básicos, carne y otros ingredieste para cocinar

loans.name: Intachables Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Intachables" están representadas por la señora Victoria y conformada por 12 miembros los cual, son un grupo de señoras que viven en los alrededores de  las cabañas del río Pirai, que se ayudan entre si, se conocen ya desde hace muchos años todas tienen diferentes tipos de negocios tales como venta de frutas, cosméticos, algunas venden comida a los ripieros que trabajan en el río, refrescos, ropa y al transporte público de pasajeros. Debido a que la competencia es muy dura en estos días las señoras utilizan el dinero que se les presta para poder incrementar su capacidad de producción o ampliar el stock de productos que tienen. Las socias van cumpliendo ya su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y ganas de sacar adelante a su familia y poderles brindar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The members of the "Intachables" (Impeccable) Community Bank are represented by Mrs. Victoria and made up of 12 members, all of whom are women who live near the shacks of the Pirai River. They help one another and have known each other for many years. They all have different types of businesses, such as sales of fruit or cosmetics, some sell food to the men who work on the river, some sell soft drinks or clothing, and some work in public transportation. Since competition is very fierce these days, the women use their loan money in order to increase their production capacity or increase their stock of products. The members are completing their second loan cycle and have demonstrated punctuality and a will to help their families get ahead and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business supplies

loans.name: Fernando Martín

texts.es:
A la vivienda el señor Fernando Martín G. le está haciendo falta la impermeabilización en el techo de la casa ya que está en muy mal condiciones y cuando llueve se le mojan los muebles de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder impermeabilizar el techo de su casa ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños y se le han estado enfermando por la humedad que hay en la casa.
El señor Fernando trabaja en una empresa donde se filma eventos sociales, en el departamento de administrador de videos, este es el ingreso que el genera para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito.
Cuando fuimos a realizar la visita a la casa del señor Fernando se encontraba en su trabaja y quien nos atendió fue su esposa la señora Rosa Isela Garza, quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. Fernando Martín G. is lacking a waterproof roof because the current one is in poor condition. The furniture inside of his house gets wet whenever it rains.

He is requesting a loan to waterproof the roof because he has three small children who have gotten sick because of the moisture that has seeped into the house. Sr. Fernando works in the video department of a company that films special events. Part of the income that he earns will be used to repay the loan.

When we visited Sr. Fernando’s home, he was not able to meet with us because he was at work. His wife, Sra. Rosa Isela Garza, is the person who appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Purísima Group

texts.es:
El grupo la purísima lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, con visión y muchos deseos de auto superación.  Maritza Elena S. S. de 34 años de edad hace dos años que puso una pulpería que gracias a los prestamos de adim ha ido creciendo hasta tenerla bien surtida con productos básicos y de consumo para el hogar. Las metas de S. son seguir incrementando el negocio y poder continuar con sus estudios superiores en la carrera de Contabilidad.

Elsa Susana M. G. de 23 años es casada y tiene dos pequeños  hijos de 5 años y tres meses respectivamente. M. vende caramelos y gaseosa y el préstamo lo invertirá para ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias invertirá en la compra de  una caponera, moto taxi utilizada en las comunidades y espera poder empezar con sus estudios de Derecho.

Juana Dolores A. de 31 años vende productos de la Avon y La Zermat marcas de gran prestigio en cosméticos, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos. Ella desea poner su propio taller de sastrería que es lo que le apasiona.
texts.en:
The group “La Purísima” consists of three hardworking women who have vision and a great desire for self-improvement. Maritza Elena S. S. is 34 years old and has managed a grocery store for the past 2 years. Thanks to the loans from ADIM, she has been able to grow her business and keep it well-stocked with basic necessities and consumer products for the home. Maritza’s goals are to continue growing her business and pursue her higher education in accounting.

Elsa Susana M. G. is 23 years old, married, and has 2 small children (ages 5 and 3 months respectively). She sells candy and sodas. Elsa will use her loan to expand her business and invest her earnings in the purchase of a “caponera”, a motorcycle taxi commonly used in her community. She hopes to begin law school.

Juana Dolores A. is 31 years old and sells products from the Avon and Zermat brands, which are well-known for cosmetics, perfumes, crèmes and other items. She hopes to open a tailoring shop because she is passionate about sewing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for their respective businesses

loans.name: Las Gramas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Gramas” están representadas por la señora Ruth Rosaylain y conformada por 17 miembros  dentro del cual las señora Aleida y Yessenia tienen negocios propios por lo que no existe dependencia económica. Los socios se dedican a la venta D. comida, como majadito ,logro ,pollo frito al horno, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrote en el mercado, lácteos, ropa para ambos sexos. El destino del financiamiento es para compra D. materiales y principalmente insumos y herramientas que ayuden realizar un trabajo más eficiente y eficaz. Este es su primer crédito comunal que adquieren como grupo se ve en las reuniones que son gente responsable y con ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group “Las Gramas” is represented by Mrs. Ruth Rosaylain and it is comprised of 17 members. There are kinships within the group like Mrs. Aleida and her daughter Yessenia. Both have their own business and there is no economic dependency between them. The members sell food like majadito (a mixture of beef jerky and rice served with a fried egg and a banana), locro (a dense, rice-based soup of chicken and vegetables), fried and baked chicken, selling makeup and groceries in the market, dairy and clothing for men and women. The loan will be used to buy materials and primarily invest in tools to help them do their job more efficiently. This is their first group loan and from the meetings they have, it seems that they are very responsible and enterprising people.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Andina Group

texts.es: El grupo “Andina” esta representado por la señora Justa y conformada por 12 señoras muy alegres y esperanzadas por el capital que se les brinda, su edades entre la mayoría oscila entre 21 a 50 años su presidenta tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales 3 ya son casados y no viven con ella y un menor que trabaja con su padre asciendo muebles, ayudando al progreso del negocio D. la familia, el resto D. la socias se dedican a la venta D. refrescos, venta D. cerveza confección D. chompas  y mantas tejidas a mano, comida y a al confección D. muebles. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para agrandar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos. Las socias van cursando ya su sexto ciclo demostrando puntualidad y mucha responsabilidad en el manejo D. los fondos creciendo más cada día.
texts.en:
The Andina group is represented by Mrs. Justa and composed of 12 happy women hopeful for the resources offered to them. For the most part their ages range between 21 and 50 years old. Their president has four daughters and of them three are married and no longer live with her. The youngest works with her father making furniture, helping grow the family business. The other members of Andina work selling drinks and beer, making hand-sewn sweaters and blankets, selling food, and making furniture. There is more competition today than in past years, but most importantly they have established customers whose requests they always fulfill. Additionally, they try to sell their product at low prices to minimize their costs and generating a reasonable income to sustain their families. Their loan will be used to acquire more merchandise, consumables, and materials to increase their business and generate larger incomes. The women are in their sixth loan cycle and have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in managing funds that grow every day.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials and merchandise

loans.name: Melania Group

texts.es:
El grupo Melania lo conforman cuatro mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras y trabajadoras, ellas son Martha G., Yessenia M., Anita M. y Modesta H.. 

Martha G. de 42 años desde hace dos años y medio comercializa los productos de la avon los cuales coloca con ayuda de su hija. Yessenia M. vende hilo, helados y comenzara a vender productos de la zermat, Anita M. tiene una pequeña pulpería y Modesta H. vende productos lácteos como crema, cuajada, queso, leche y leche agria.

loans.use: comprar cosmeticos, perfumes y cremas

loans.name: 15 De Diciembre Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “15 D. Diciembre” esta representado por la señora Laura y conformado por 12 miembros que se caracterizan por ser unido y responsable, son dinámicas. La presidenta se dedica a la venta D. productos D. cosméticos por catalogo, el resto del grupo se dedica ala venta D. comida en snack en el col costa rica, venta en confitería pero en general las socias se dedican a la venta D. comidas típicas en la zona donD. residen. La competencia hoy en día se ve más que en otros años pero lo importante es que ellas tienen clientes fijos y ellas siempre cumplen al pedido D. sus clientes, además tratan D. vender su producto a un menor precio minimizando sus costos y  generando una ganancia razonable para el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para compra D. materiales y principalmente insumos y herramientas que ayuden realizar un trabajo más eficiente y eficaz. Este es su primer crédito comunal que adquieren como grupo se ve en las reuniones que son gente responsable y con ganas D. salir adelante.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Mercedes Adilia

texts.es: Doña Mercedes Adilia es pequeña comerciante del sector de La Libertad, Chontales, ha cancelado 4 creditos en los que ha demostrado excelente conducta de pago, actualmente solicita el 5to credito para continuar mejorando su vivienda, pues necesita levantar las paredes internas de su casa y ponerle el piso y si el credito lo permite cambiar el techo de la casa que se encuentra en mal estado y de esta manera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su marido que asume los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes Adilia is a small businesswoman who works in the region of La Libertad, Chontales. She completed 4 previous loans in which she demonstrated an excellent payment history. Doña Mercedes is now requesting a 5th loan to continue improvements to her home. She needs to raise the inside walls of her house and install a floor. If there is enough money left over, she will replace the roof because it is in poor condition. Through this loan, she hopes to improve her family’s living conditions and support her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise the internal walls, install a floor, and replace the roof

loans.name: El Amor 1 And 4 Group

texts.en:
Valentina is the group coordinator of El Amor (The Love).  Her story is representative of the others in her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Valentina's group is based in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic that has unreliable access to resources such as potable running water and electricity. Valentina lives with her two children (ages 20 and 19) and one grandson. 

Valentina has proven she is an excellent Esperanza client by repaying seven loans. She plans to use this loan, her eighth, to continue to grow her business and buy more shoes to sell.  She hopes to someday have her own store where she can sell her shoes.  Currently, she sells the shoes from her home.  

Valentina would like to use the money she earns in her business to continue to improve the living conditions in her house. The loans she has taken with Esperanza in the past have helped her to provide for her family.

loans.use: Shoes

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A. is 36 years old and married to Alejandro A. who is a 37-year-old rice farmer. The couple has three very young children who range in age from 1 to 11 years old. The family lives in the village of Brgy. Ayungon, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. Her fondest dream is to improve her family's standard of living, to earn enough to sustain the needs of her family and to send her children to school.

Ma Fe knows and understands so well that her husband strives hard to earn for them but it is still not enough because as a farmer he earns a seasonal type of income, rice being harvested only after 3 to 4 months of planting. That’s why Ma Fe looked for another source of income so that she could help her husband increase the household income. Using some of her husband's income from the farm as capital, she put up a small general store adjacent to their house selling basic household commodities that her neighbors needed. She just revolved the income she earned to buy new stocks to sell, until 2003 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to access more capital to expand her operations. As she paid off each loan, she was able to borrow bigger amounts effectively increasing her income capacity. It now earns a net profit of PHP 3,000 per month, which is a big help to this young household. Being a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon has also helped in their rice production as she has used some of the loans to purchase fertilizer for her husband's rice farm, also improving the yield at harvest time.

For her previous 13th cycle loan, she borrowed Php 13,000 as additional working capital for her general store and for the rice farm. She paid all her weekly installments in full and on time without any delays. Now she is borrowing for her 14th cycle, a loan of Php 15,000 to be used as additional capital for her general store and to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. The income from this loan will be saved for the education of her children and part will be used to pay for their household expenses.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her general store and rice farm

loans.name: Ignacia Emilia

texts.es: Doña ignacia es pequeña comerciante, dueña de una pulperia ubicada en la salida a El Ayote frenta a una vulcanizacion, en este lugar llega gente que viaja de varias comarcas por lo que vende sus productos con bastante rotacion, ademas tiene una pequeña comideria en donde vende comida rapida a los productores y negociantes que visitan la zona, obteniendo de estos negocios ganancias que le permiten obtener buenas ganancias para los gastos familiares y el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ignacia is a small businesswoman and owner of a small grocery store located at the exit of El Ayote facing a vulcanization site. People travel from various regions come through El Ayote, which allows Ignacia to sell her products with a high turnover. She has a small restaurant where she sells fast food to the producers and businessmen who visit the area. This extra revenue allows her to make greater earnings to pay for household costs and paying quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small grocery store and restuarant

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita es casada, de 42 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 12 y el otro de 8 años, ambos estudiando la secundaria y primaria,  labora para el MINSA desempeñandose como Enfermera Especial responsable de la zona # 3 de Juigalpa, con 16 años de servicio, con sus creditos ha logrado dar mejores condiciones a su casa a pesar que hasta ahora será beneficiada con el fondo kiva, esta solicitando su 7mo credito y espera que AFODENIC y KIVA le apoyen para lograr la construccion de un cuarton para su hijo mayor, puesto que quiere brindar mayor comodidad a sus hijos, pues estan creciendo y necesitan privacidad, y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Construccion de un cuarto

loans.name: Leslie Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Leslie de 46 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos ya son mayores y son independientes, se recibio de abogada pero no esta ejerciendo totalmente su carrera, pues se dedica la mayor parte del tiempo a administrar una pequeña tienda que tiene en su casa de habitacion ubicada en Cuapa, Chontales.  Esta solicitando su 3er credito para comprar mercaderia e invertir en su tienda, vende ropa, cosmeticos y articulos que le encargan sus clientes.  Expresa se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos que AFODENIC le ha brindado, pues con estos ha podido incrementar poco a poco su negocio, aunque ahora logre ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva que apoya a las personas que desean superarse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leslie is 46 years old. She is single and has grown-up children who are independent. She has a law degree but is not using it fully. She dedicates the majority of her time to manage a small store she has in her house in Cuapa Chontales. She is asking for her third loan to buy merchandise and invest in her store. She sells clothes, cosmetics, and other products her customers order. She is very grateful for the financing AFODENIC has provided since it's allowed her to grow her business little by little. Now she is a beneficiary of Kiva, which supports people who want to better themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing and cosmetic store

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin G. who lives in the town of Pulupandan, Negros Occidental, is 58 years old and married to Felizardo G. who helps her in running their business.  They are blessed with nine children who are between 13 and 37 years old. Some of the older children have already graduated from college and have their own families. Jasmin now has nine children, but even when they have their own families, her older children still help support the family. 

Jasmin started her business by selling bananas in their community and other neighboring villages. During that time, she admitted that her business did not fare so well because sometimes she hardly saved or gained extra income due to the needs of her children and family. But when NWTF-Project Dungganon opened in their area, her husband encouraged her to join. In the year 1998, she was able to join and become a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon. When she received her first loan, she invested it as additional capital for her business. After a while, she decided to buy other kinds of fruit so that she could sell not just bananas to her regular customers. With that decision, she expanded her business using her loans as capital, and her business improved a lot. From banana and fruit vending, now she has a permanent place in the Pulupandan market for her general store. She also sells fruits and vegetables. Her business ventures earn a minimum of Php 15,000 per month and some portion of this income is recycled back into the business and used as additional capital, for the education of her younger children, and to pay for their household expenses. All the extra income is saved in the bank for future use. 

For her previous loan, she borrowed Php 10,000 to use as additional working capital for her business. The loan was as usual, fully paid on time without any delays, maintaining Jasmin's good credit record at NWTF-Project Dungganon. For now, she is borrowing Php 15,000 to purchase additional products for her general store and for her fruit and vegetable business.

Her next plan is to improve her general store and buy some additional products to sell in their community. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fruits & vegetables and additional products to sell in her general store

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel E. O. tiene 30 años, es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador. Su actividad económica es la pesca, hace mas de 16 años que inicio este negocio Carlos tuvo que aprenderlo a muy temprana edad ya que tenía que mantener a sus 3 hijos y a su esposa que para él son lo más importante. Todos los días Carlos se levanta muy temprano, ya que tiene que arreglar sus redes para recoger muchos peces, últimamente ha presentado problemas como es poco capital de trabajo. Actualmente Carlos solicita el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la reparación del motor de su lancha, redes nuevas, ciertas herramientas que se utilizan en este negocio. su deseo es seguir adelante para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel E. O. is 30 years old, and is a very responsible and hardworking man. He has been engaged in the business of fishing for over 16 years. Carlos had to learn this business at a very young age, given that he had to support his 3 children and his wife, which he considers to be most important. Every day Carlos gets up very early, since he must rig up his nets so that he can catch a lot of fish. He has recently experienced problems with insufficient working capital. He is currently requesting a loan for working capital that will be used to repair the motor of his boat, and to purchase new nets and certain tools that he uses in his business. His desire is to continue to advance so that he can help his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Danilo

texts.es: DAnilo G. A., tiene 41 años de edad, casado,  y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Gracias al prestamo de Fudecosur, pudo comprar una vaca para la produccion de leche. Hace muchos años que se dedica al campo y la ganaderia y quiere crecer.Es el segundo prestamo que ha recibido de Fudecosur. El manifiesta que no tenia problemas en el campo hace cinco años, pero desea crecer, por tal razón decide realizar el prestamo y ver la posibilidad de crecer. Además, él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable. También, desea que sus hijos se superen y estudien y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Danilo G. A. is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children who are his first priority. Thanks to the loan he received from Fudecosur he was able to puchase a cow for the production of milk. For years he’s been dedicated to farming and cattle, and would like to expand. This is the second loan he’s received from Fudecosur. He says he didn’t have any challenges in the past 5 years in farming but he wishes to grow, so he took out the loan to have the opportunity to do so. Besides this, he wishes to provide his wife and children with a better, more stable future. He also wishes that his children better themselves, study, and grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Hugo

texts.en:
Hugo was a driver in his native Ecuador so, when he moved to the States, it was a natural choice to continue in his profession, and he started his own high-occupancy van transportation business in 2000. One of the major costs of a business like Hugo's is constant maintenance of the vehicle fleet. Hugo was able to cover these costs with a credit card, but it was very costly and only a short-term fix.

Hugo used his first loan to do some maintenance on his van, but this loan served another purpose which was building up and improving his credit history. Now Hugo will be taking out a second loan to cover more maintenance costs, and he hopes to buy a second van soon.

Hugo is optimistic that he will be able to expand his business because his ACCION USA loans have improved his credit rating. He says he is grateful because he feels the loans have lifted him up economically, and he is now more financially comfortable than he would have been if he had kept using credit cards. In addition to buying a new van, Hugo wants to continue to keep his vans in great shape so they will stay functional for years to come.

loans.use: To pay for van maintenance and inspection tags

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
She's a dedicated and hardworking mother who strives hard just to provide for the needs of her family. Her name is Cirila G.. She lives in Yulo’s Park, Brgy 14, Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She is 53 years old and is married to Rogelio G. who helps her in running their business. The couple is blessed with three adult children and some of them have their own families already.  Cirila is happy to have three grandchildren.

Because she had the knowledge and skills to make “Bibingka”, a native Ilonggo delicacy that is made with rice flour, coconut milk, sugar and young coconut strips cooked in a top-fired oven, she started this business in 1996 with the help of her husband. They set up a cart with a specially made "bibingka" oven that enabled them to make and sell hot "bibingka" in different places that have high foot traffic. On Sundays, they setup their mobile "bibingka" bakery in front of the cathedral where Sunday mass goers could buy their product when they come out of the church after attending mass. On weekdays, they setup in front of schools with high student population. 

In 2005, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to gain access to additional capital for her business. Because of the additional capital, she was able to improve her business income so that on the 3rd cycle, she decided to invest her loan not on her "bibingka" business but instead invest it in a backyard pig-fattening venture. This gave her a good return on her business after three to four months when she sold the pigs, enabling her to increase her income even further. The two ventures give her a combined average income of PHP 3,000 per week, which pays for their household expenses and school expenses, with some left over for savings.

Cirila is happy that her husband and children also help out in her business. For one week this October, they have setup their mobile store at the Bacolod Public Plaza because of the high pedestrian traffic in the area when Bacolod City celebrates its weeklong "Masskara" Festival. Cirila's "Bibingka" has gathered many regular customers and she has started receiving advance orders.

For her previous loan, she borrowed Php 27,000, which she used as additional capital for her business and it was fully paid on time and in full within her loan term. Now she is borrowing for her 12th cycle, a loan of Php 29,500 to be used as additional working capital for her business. The income from it will be be used to improve the living conditions of her family and some will be set aside as savings for future emergencies.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: G.s Sangre De Cristo Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Sangre de Cristo está conformado por Hermenejilda P. M., Rosa Alpina M. Z.. Sus actividades económicas son diferentes, pero esto no les impide desarrollar una amistad y lograr sacar adelante a sus familias y negocios. Hermenejilda se dedica a la venta de frijoles, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, en cambio Rosa se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es su única fuente de ingresos para su familia. Ambas trabajaron desde muy joven para sacar a cada una de sus familias. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y así comprar materia prima. El sueño de estas 2 integrantes es salir adelante con sus negocios.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria L. who lives in the village of  Hda. San Jose Baling, Libacao, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is 48 years old and married to Panfilo L., Jr. who presently manages their sugarcane farm. They are blessed with three children who are 12 to 15 years of age, and are all in high school. They strive hard to earn enough this year because their oldest daughter is about to start college next year, with the two younger ones following fast behind.

The family has a small sugarcane farm, which is a seasonal type of business. It is harvested only once a year. As the demand for a better cash flow increased as their daughters were growing, Victoria knew she had to find an alternate means of income. This is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 to access capital to start a general store.

Because of her skills in predicting which products would be popular with her customers, Victoria was able to build her business with the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was even able to help her husband fund some of the operations in their sugarcane farm. Now her General Store earns her an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Her previous loan of Php 29,500 was used as additional working capital for her general store and for her sugarcane plantation. Her loan was fully paid on time within the loan term. Now for her 22nd cycle, she is borrowing the same amount, Php 29,500, for her general store. The income will be used for house renovation, savings for education and for future investments.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Andrés Moises

texts.es:
Andrés Moises C. O. es un joven señor de 28 años de edad el cual vive con sus padres, su esposa  y sus dos pequeños hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Andrés  se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito, tanto en producción de leche y queso como la venta de carne; ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque  su proyecto ha crecido bastante y gracias  a el ha podido salir adelante.

Don Andrés desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar tres novillos más y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser una microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a toda su  familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero y dedicación.

Don Andrés es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Andrés Moises C. O. is a young man who is 28 years old and lives with his parents, his wife, and their two small children in the community of Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela Province. This community lies in a mountainous area and is near the northern border of the country. The principal business activities are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Don Andrés raises cattle for two purposes: dairy products (milk and cheese) and meat sales. This is the means by which he generates income for his family. He says he is very happy because his business has grown significantly and he is now able to get ahead.

Don Andrés hopes to obtain a microloan of 685,000 colones to buy three additional steers so that he can increase his production. He knows that acquiring more cattle takes great sacrifice and demands more work. However, his desire to become a successful micro-entrepreneur and improve his family’s living condition motivates him to proceed with great care and dedication.

Don Andrés is a member of La Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his second loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He is thankful for these type of organizations that facilitate credit so that he can spend more time focusing on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 steers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
After many years as a stay-at-home mom, Nancy realized that she wanted her own career once her children were grown. Initially she wanted to go into traditional medicine and become a doctor, but she ultimately found alternative medicine more appealing.
 
Nancy began her holistic medicine and acupuncture business five years ago. Just after starting her business she and her husband divorced and went through bankruptcy. This made it pretty much impossible for her to receive a loan from a traditional bank. However, she found a new sense of confidence after realizing that she has a viable business and would in fact be eligible for a micro-loan from Opportunity Fund.
 
Nancy needs $8,000 to buy pre-packed supplements and to buy an alkaline water system. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to include workshops for other midlife women who are trying to find a new career in life or possibly start their own businesses. She feels that no one should “let life’s circumstances prevent them from doing what they want”.

loans.use: To buy pre-packed supplements and an alkaline water system

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro E. ella tiene 60 años de edad, es mujer casada. La señora Vicenta tiene una pequeña pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, en la cual vende granos básicos y otros artículos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años. Porque su mama quería ingresos adicionales que reemplazaran la escasez de trabajo. a pesar de presentar una edad muy avanzada le disfruta mucho de trabajo y le gusta conversar con sus clientes. Su crédito será invertido en la compra principalmente de granos básicos, ya que en este momento aprovecha a comprar y almacenar para cuando los granos básicos suban de precio tener almacenado para sus clientes fijos. Su sueño es llegar a instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban T. G. es un joven señor de 31 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; ésta comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar y naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años don Esteban se dedica a la ganadería especialmente a la producción de leche y sus derivados. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. 

Don Esteban considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y han logrado ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad.

Actualmente don Esteban desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar 3 vacas más y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Esteban es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Esteban T. G. is a young man of 31 years old who lives with his wife and their three kids in a community called Santa Fe located in Los Chiles, in the province of Alajuela. This community is notably a mountainous area and is close to the northern border of our country. Its principal economic activities are cattle-raising and agriculture, specifically growing basic grain staples, sugar cane and oranges. For a number of years, Don Esteban has worked with cattle, in particular the production of milk and other dairy products. He sells his products to his neighbors in the community who are very satisfied with the quality of the products he offers. Right now, Don Esteban would like a loan of ¢685.000 (six hundred and eighty-five thousand colones) to buy three additional cows and increase his production. He knows that having more cows will require more work and require a bigger sacrifice. Without a doubt, his desire to be a successful micro-entrepeneur and to help his family get ahead motivate him to work even harder. Don Esteban is a member of the Santa Fe Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial (Manantial Community Credit Company), one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with the loan he hopes to improve his personal and economic situation. Also, it is clear that due to this type of organization and the convenient access to credit, he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of three milk cows

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias V Group

texts.en:
Santa (pictured furthest left) is the group coordinator of Banco de Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Mujeres Solidarias (Women United). Her story is representative of those in her group and more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Her group is based in Hato Mayor, a small rural area of the Dominican Republic. Her house does not have running water and she has unreliable access to electricity.  She lives with her husband and four children (ages 19, 18, 16, and 15). 

Santa has successfully repaid five loans with Esperanza and is seeking a sixth loan to buy more items to sell in her store.  She sells various items for the house including sheets, kitchen items, pillows and interior decorations.  She plans to invest in plastic chairs with this loan to sell in her store. 

Santa has been able to improve her life with the profits she has made from her business.  She recently purchased a stove for her house and hopes to someday purchase a washing machine for her house.  She likes working with Esperanza because it encourages her to work hard and work together with all of those in her group.

loans.use: Plastic chairs to sell

loans.name: Marcia Leonor

texts.es: Marcia Leonor Martínez García tiene la edad de 37 años, es una madre soltera por lo que tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que con mucho sacrificio asisten a un colegio público y recibe la educación necesaria. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 que se dedica a este negocio, pero importante resaltar que es un negocio ambulante, que nació por su familia ya que su Mama era la que se encargaba de administrar el negocio, pero al fallecer ella Marcia decidió hacerse cargo de esta actividad. La metodología que Marcia utiliza es brindar los productos de cosméticos y ropa a personas que trabajan en instituciones, colegios, tiendas entre otros. El sueño de ella es mantener su negocio y lograr obtener más recursos para invertir su inventario y también proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que sus hijos tengan un lugar decente donde vivir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Marcia Leonor Martínez García is 37 years old and is a single mother with three children in her care who due to her sacrifices attend public school and are getting a good education. She has sold general merchandise for the last four years as a street vendor. Her mother used to run the business but when her mother died, Marcia decided to take over. Marcia offers cosmetics and clothing to people who work in institutions, schools and stores as well as in other locations. Her dream is to keep her business going and to invest in additional inventory. She would also like to be able to improve her home to give her kids a good place to live in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nora Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Nora Alicia G. le está haciendo falta el techo en la parte trasera de la casa. 
Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarla mano de obra ya que quiere ponerla de concreto para que sea más duradera. 
La señora Nora Alicia es pensionada trabaja mucho tiempo en el seguro social de la ciudad como enfermera. En la casa viven ella y un hijo quien le ayuda con los gastos familiares, así que una parte de la pensión será para pagar el crédito.
Doña Nora Alicia G. ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.

loans.use: Colocación de techo en la parte trasera de la casa

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de los Ángeles A. tiene la edad de 28 años, es madre soltera y con 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Anteriormente ella no tenía trabajo para alimentar a sus hijos y al tener la necesidad de proporcionarle a sus hijos el alimento diario se dedico este negocio, a pesar de los desafíos que enfrento como fue el no tener apoyo de su esposo ya que ella tuvo que luchar sola. Es por eso que el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pantalones, camisas, calzado, faldas, cremas y colonias. Siempre ha soñado con que sus hijos obtengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles A. is 28 years old, a single mother of 2 children. For a living she sells merchandise en general. Previously she did not have a job in order to provide food for her children, but due to the necessity of having to provide her children with their daily meals she began with this business in spite of the challenges she faces not counting on the support of her husband as she had to fight alone. The loan requested will be used as work capital to buy trousers, shirts, shoes, skirts, creams, and colognes. It has always been her dream that her children may have better life conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 1, 2 And 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the group coordinator for Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Rayo D. Luz (Ray of Light). Her story is representative of the others in her group and also more generally of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients. Maria lives in Hato Mayor, a rural area in the Dominican Republic.  Her house has unreliable access to non-potable running water and electricity. She lives in a house with her husband and 10-year-old son. 

Maria operates a bakery that sells sweets called Dulces D. Maria. She runs her business out of her home and sells sweets, bread and other food items like fruit juice.  This will be her fourth loan with Esperanza after successfully paying back her previous three loans.  She plans to use this loan to purchase food items to sell and ingredients so she can make items to sell.  She specifically needs flour, rice, sugar, oil, eggs and butter.  

Maria wants to continue to improve her living conditions by working hard and advancing her family.  Her dream is to one day be able to afford her own pastry store so she doesn't have to operate her business from her home.

loans.use: Food products including: butter, sugar, oil, eggs, flour, rice, wheat

loans.name: Eval Antonio

texts.es:
