Eval Antonio  Hernández T. es un joven señor de 21 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde muy joven Eval se ha dedicado a la ganadería de doble propósito aprovechando tanto la carne como la producción de leche.  Comenta que es muy buen negocio ya que el logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. 

Eval considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y espera seguir haciéndolo.

Actualmente Eval desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar 2 vacas más y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con un mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Eval es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Compra de dos vacas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro José M. Tellez es un señor de 47 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Pedro se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la ganadería, especialmente le saca provecho al ganado para engorde, ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante.

Don Pedro desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo; pero dice que así podrá fortalecer más su proyecto y así llegará a ser un microempresario exitoso.

Don Pedro es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Pedro José M. Tellez is a 47 year-old gentleman who lives with his wife and son in a community called Santa Fe located in Los Chiles, province of Alajuela. This community is a mountainous area close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities are livestock and agriculture, specifically sowing of basic grains, sugar canes, and oranges.

Since he was very young Don Pedro has been a livestock farmer, specializing in fattening livestock as a way of generating income for his family. He says he is pleased because this project has enabled him to get ahead.

Don Pedro requests a micro credit of 685,000 colones to buy more cows and thus increase the production. He is aware that having more cows represents more sacrifice and work, but he says that it will strengthen his project and he will become a successful micro-businessman.

Don Pedro is a member of the "Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe", one of 100 organizations partners of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and it will enable him to grow on a personal and economic level. He also points out that thanks to this kind of organizations and means to facilitate loans he can spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cows to be fattened.

loans.name: Cristalina Group

texts.es:
El grupo cristalina está integrado por Hidalya del Socorro S. V. de 29 años, Yadirco del Socorro A. de 29 años y Ramón Francisco B. A. de 27 años. Ellos son originarios de San Pedro.

S. es la coordinadora del grupo ella inicio hace tres años vendiendo pan y fresco en su casa actualmente tiene una pequeña pulpería bien surtida. Mientras A. vende verduras y B. vende granos básicos.

Ellos necesitan el crédito para incrementar su negocios respectivamente y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Cristalina" are Hidalya del Socorro S. V., 29 years old, Yadirco del Socorro A., 29 years old, and Ramón Francisco B. A., 27 years old. There are from San Pedro.

S. is the coordinator of the group. She started three years ago selling bread and pops at home. Presently she has a small well-supplied general store. A. sells vegetables and B. sells basic grains.

They need the loan to increase their respective businesses and continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, dairy and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne pour la revente

loans.name: Esperanza Divina 1 And 2 Group

texts.en:
Dima is the group coordinator for Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Esperanza Divina (Divine Hope).  Her story is representative of the other members of her group and more generally of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients.  Dima lives in Hato Mayor, a rural part of the Dominican Republic.  She has unreliable access to running water (not potable) and electricity. Dima lives with her husband and has three grown sons.

Dima has proved to be an excellent client and has successfully repaid nine loans.  This will be her tenth loan.  She plans to use it to buy more household items to sell in her store. She sells items like pots and pans, sheets, and clothing. 

Dima's dream is to be able to construct her own house. Her house is maD. out of wood and she would like to work hard so that she can afford to build a new house out of cement. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she will be able to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Household items to sell including: pots and pans, sheets, clothing

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es:
El señor Sabino T. está solicitando un préstamo para colocar el vitropiso en toda la casa ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejor en horario adicional a su empleo.
Don Sabino trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de mensajería, entregando documentos en diferentes partes de la ciudad, este es el ingreso que obtiene y con el cual pagara el préstamo ya que su esposa la señora Laura Soto se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su empleo, limpiando casa en la vecina ciudad.
Cuando fuimos a tomar la foto al domicilio del señor Sabino el no se encontraba en su casa y quien nos atendió fue la señora Laura Soto quien es la persona que aparece en la foto.
texts.en:
Mr. Sabino T. is requesting a loan to place "vitropiso", tiles on all the floors of his house as he does not have the necessary money to buy the material at this moment. He himself will make the improvement after his regular work hours. Don Sabino works at a transportation company in the messenger department in charge of documents from different parts of town. This is his income source and he will use it to repay the loan as his wife, Mrs. Laura Soto is responsible for the family expenses with the income from her job cleaning houses in the neighboring town. When we visited his home to take the photo, Mr. Sabino was not present, his wife Laura Soto is the person in the photograph.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tiles for floors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de téléphone illico

loans.name: Las Peras Group

texts.es:
El grupo las peras está conformado por  Silvia Elena L. B., Miriam Escarleth A., Fátima del Rosario S. y Cruz Alfonzo L. Rivas. Ellas son del Raizon, Nindiri.

Silvia L. de 33 años comenzó hace tres años vendiendo sopas los domingos y actualmente ella vende comida los fines de semana el sábado hace fritanga y los domingos sopas. Ella ocupara el préstamo para adquirir artículos para el negocio como platos, tasas, cucharas y productos como yuca, hueso, carne, granos básicos, papa, ayote entre otros.

Mientras Miriam Escarlet A. vende fritanga, Fátima del Rosario S. vende cosméticos y Cruz Alfonzo L. vende ropa nueva y usada.

loans.use: para comprar carne, verduras, huesos, granos básicos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de pagne pour la revente

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Maravilla está conformado Leonardo M. T., Heydy H. y Estelvina V. U..  Ellos son originarios de san Francisco, Nindiri.

M. de 48 años desde hace diecinueve años tiene un taller de mueblería, el en un principio alquiló un taller con todas sus herramientas y solo realizaba canastas luego a solicitud de sus clientes empezó a realizar diferentes muebles como roperos.  El invertirá su crédito en compra de madera e insumos para realizar muebles y su sueño es llegar a remodelar su taller y comprar un vehículo. 

Los otros dos integrantes Heydy H. y Estelvina Valdivia vende ropa nueva y usada.

loans.use: madera, clavos, pintura, pega etc

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: José Noel C. Núñez tiene 37 años, su actividad economía es la venta de cocteles y ceviches, el tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que todavía asisten a clases. Su negocio consiste en comprar pescado, conchas, camarones para preparar los diferentes platillos para ofrecerlos a sus diferentes clientes. Hace más de 5 años que inicio este negocio,  ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a ofrecer sus servicios como obrero, pero al no sufragar los suficientes gastos de su familia decidió dedicarse a la venta de estos platillos, con el tiempo ha logrado obtener los suficientes clientes que le han proporcionado la estabilidad en su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su deseo es comprar un medio de transporte para ofrecer sus productos de una manera mucho mas rápida.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sewing products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: acheter de l'huile, du haricot, du riz, tomates en boîtes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat des condiments et de sel, gimgenbre etc.

loans.name: Las Catarritas Group

texts.es: El grupo las Catarritas está integrado Blanca Zenovia H. de 20 años ella comenzó vendiendo ropa interior y ahora vende perfumes y electrodomésticos, María Celina Zabala F. de 25 años vende perfumes, María de los Santos G. L. de 72 años vende caramelos, bombones y tortillitas y Rosa Inés E.  ella vende prendas de plata.
texts.en:
The Las Catarritas group consists of 20-year-old Blanca Zenobia H., who began by selling undergarments and now sells perfumes and appliances, 25-year-old María Celina Zabala F., who sells perfumes, 72-year-old María de los Santos G. L., who sells candies, chocolates and little tortillas, and Rosa Inés E., who sells pieces of silver.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more perfumes

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina García Hernández tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Rosa tiene 3 hijos. La actividad económica de Rosa es la venta de mercadería en general. Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Rosa dio inicio su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos. Su financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de ropa, prendas de oro laminado, plata, bolsos, calzado entre otros. El deseo de Rosa es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sea un buen profesional.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr: Yawovi  S. est un homme de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants.  Il habite à Kpadape, un village situé à 10 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un transformateur du vin de palm en sodabi. Il achète des palmiers, les abats et quelque jour après, il vient recueilli du vin de palm avec lequel il fabrique le sodabi. Avec ce crédit, il voudrait acheter des palmiers pour sa transformation en sodabi. Il compte épargner de l’argent avec les bénéfices qu’il obtiendra. Dans l’avenir, il aimerait avoir une usine de fabrication de vin communément appelé au Togo « SODABI ».

loans.use: production de la boisson locale ( sodabi )

loans.name: Eduardo Rey

texts.es:
Eduardo Rey G. G. es un señor de 34 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija de tres meses en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Don Eduardo se ha dedicado desde muy joven a la ganadería, especialmente le saca provecho al ganado para engorde, ya que es una forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Dice estar muy contento porque gracias a este proyecto ha podido salir adelante.

Don Eduardo desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢685.000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar más vacas y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con más vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo; pero dice que así podrá mejorar y fortalecer más su proyecto y así llegará a ser un microempresario exitoso y poder ofrecerle una calidad de vida mejor para su esposa y para ofrecerle un buen futuro a su hija.

Don Eduardo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Eduardo Rey G. G. is 34 years old who lives with his wife and small three-month-old daughter in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous region and for being very close to the northern border of the country. Its main economic activities are raising livestock and agriculture, growing specifically grains, sugar cane and oranges. Since his youth, Don Eduardo has raised livestock, specifically benefitting from fattening cattle, as a way to bring an income to his family. He says he is very happy because he has been able to make a successful living thanks to this project. Don Eduardo would like to obtain a microloan of ¢685 colones ($1,200) in order to buy more cattle and thus increase production. He knows that increasing his number of cows is a sacrifice that will demand more of his time, but with them he will be able to further improve and strengthen his project and develop a successful small business and be able to offer a better quality of life for his wife and a good future for his daughter. Don Eduardo a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, one of the 100 member organizationes of EDESA in Costa Rica. This would be his first loan, and with it he hopes to grow on both the personal and economic levels. He also points out that, thanks to these kinds of organizations and creditors, he can dedicate more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cattle for fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: aménagement local

loans.name: Betriz Irene

texts.es: Beatriz Irene R. M. is married, her husband is a steelworker. They have a four year old son who isn’t in school yet. Beatriz started her business with the sale of cooked beans, since, she has expanded to offer cheese, soft drinks, milk and cream and fire wood for other people’s stoves. She plans to use this loan to buy a high quality stove with an oven. With the continued success of her business, Beatriz dreams of increasing the amount of products she has to offer. Beatriz took a course in small restaurant management and hopes to open her own shop where she will offer products of the highest quality.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Paula Benita

texts.es: Paula Benita G. R. is 39 years old and has three children. The older two are married and the youngest, at 21 years old, is finishing her studies. Doña G. R. has run a clothing store for fifteen years, offering different styles of clothing and accessories to her clientele. She plans to use this loan to purchase clothing for men, women and children from contacts she has in the nearby cities of Managua and Chinandega. Doña G. R. says that although she has to deal with customers who are reluctant to pay, her mother, who also ran a clothing store, taught her how to run a successful business. She dreams of home improvements and living a little more comfortably.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Tres Combos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Tres Combos está conformado por Emilia de Carmen Z. S. quien comenzó vendiendo helados y choco bananos y actualmente vende ropa, Mariela del Socorro P. quien vende perfumes y ropa,  Maritza del Socorro L. vende helados y choco bananos y Ana María P. vende ropa. 

Todas ellas neceitan el crédito para por invertir en su negocio y salir adelante. La meta inmediata de ellas es mejorar su calidad de vida por ella y sus familias.

loans.use: comprar ropa y perfumes

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina Isabel G. M. es una señora de 47 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Doña Reina se desde hace algunos años inicio su propio negocio una pulpería (tiendita de abarrotes) para vender productos básicos a sus vecinos en su propia casa; con este negocio ha logrado tener  una actividad económica rentable que la ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente ella necesita un préstamo por ¢685.000(seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones) para comprar mercadería que pueda vender y así continuar con su negocio. Específicamente comprará abarrotes básicos como arroz, frijoles, verduras, productos enlatados, refrescos, jabón y todo lo que se refiere a la canasta básica del costarricense que vive en las zonas rurales. Doña Reina comenta que el servicio que ella brinda es muy importante ya que no existen otra pulpería cercana a esa zona  por lo tanto comenta que tiene bastantes clientes. 

Doña Reina es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.

loans.use: Inventario y Mercadería

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito: Successful Women Group

texts.es:
Un buen día L. señora Miriam M. vio que iban a empezar una gran construcción cerca D. su casa era una obra muy granD. L. construcción D. mil casas, elL. pensó que mucha gente iba a trabajar en ese lugar por algún tiempo, es así que impulsada por una amiga  se le ocurre L. idea D. vender  comida para los trabajadores D. dicha obra, estaba segura que los trabajadores buscarían un lugar donD. comer, ya que en esa zona no había restaurantes es así que sin perder tiempo saca los permisos necesarios y ofrece sus servicios pidiendo autorización aL. misma empresa constructora.  empieza vendiendo almuerzo y desayuno a los trabajadores, fue difícil al principio ya que solo 5 personas le compraban y muchas veces se quedaba con comida que no vendía pero gracias su paciencia, trato amable y  carisma logra obtener mas clientes llegando actualmente a atender a  50 comensales que disfrutan D. su buena sazón y cordialidad .
L. señora Miriam sabe que esta obra terminara pronto es por eso que espera tener un puesto D. venta D. comida en el mercado D. su localidad, con mucha felicidad nos cuenta que ya encontró el lugar indicado ahora esta ahorrando por que le falta comprar una congeladora y también implementar el lugar con todo lo necesario. Sabe que tiene el apoyo D. su familia especialmente D. su esposo que L. ayuda en todo, el actualmente gestiona su jubilación y como el proceso es largo trabaja con elL.. Ambos se dedican al negocio,  quieren lograr cosas mas grandes como tener su propio restaurante.L. señora Miriam esta tan segura D. lograrlo que ya tiene el nombre que le pondrá a su negocio “L. RAMADITA” además D. esto también se ayuda con un pequeño negocio D. fotocopias y tipeo  en su misma casa. El préstamo D. EDAPROSPO le va a servir D. mucho ya que lo invertirá en L. compra D. vajillas y enseres para mejorar su cocina y brindar una buena  atención a sus futuros clientes.

*Miriam M. es L. señora que esta sentada con chompa guinda
texts.en:
One fine day Miriam M. saw that they were going to begin a big construction work close to her house; a huge building site that involved the construction of a thousand houses. She thought that many people would be working at this place for a while, and so, encouraged by a friend, it occurred to her to sell food to the workers at this building site. She was sure that the workers would be looking for a place to eat, as there were no restaurants in that area. So, without any time to lose, she applied for the necessary permits and offered her services, requesting authorisation from the construction company. She began by selling breakfast and lunch to the workers. It was difficult at first as only five people purchased food from her, and many times she was left with food that she didn't sell, but thanks to her patience, kind ways and charisma she managed to obtain more clients, and she now currently attends to fifty customers who enjoy her flavour and her warmth. Miriam knows that this construction work will finish soon and because of this she hopes to put up a stall selling food in her local market. It is with much happiness that she tells us that she has already found the location. She tells us that she is already saving because she still has to buy a freezer and also fit out the space with all the necessary items. She knows that she has the support of her family, especially her husband who supports her in everything. He is currently arranging to retire and as it is a long process he is working with her. Both of them are dedicated to the business, they want to achieve big things such as opening their own restaurant - Miriam is so sure of achieving her goal that she has already chosen the name that she will call her business: "L. Ramadita". As well as this she is also helping out with a small photocopying business and types in her own home. The loan from EDAPROSPO will help her a lot as she will invest in crockery and utensils to improve her kitchen and offer a great service to her future clients. *Miriam M. is the woman who is seated wearing a cherry-coloured jumper

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crockery and utensils for her catering business

loans.name: Gerald Nelson

texts.es: Gerald Nelson S. V. tiene 30 años de edad. Es un hombre muy trabajador. Se dedica a ofrecer los servicios de transporte, el tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que logro mantener estos pequeños contratos y ha logrado aprovecharlo ya que es por medio de este trabajo que su hijo ha logrado tener la oportunidad de estudiar, el siempre disfruta de su trabajo ya que recorre muchos lugares y así le da la facilidad de conocer más clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para invertir en su camión y proporcionarle ciertas mejoras. El sueña con mantener siempre activo este financiamiento ya que son muy necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerald Nelson S. V. is 30 years old and a very hardworking man. He has provided a public transport service for the last six years which is how he has managed to maintain small contracts, and in so doing his son has had the opportunity to study. Gerald has always enjoyed his work as he has travelled to many places and this has made it easier to meet more clients. The loan that he is applying for will be used as working capital to invest in his vehicle and make certain improvements. He dreams of making this loan a reality as the improvements he needs to make are invaluable for the development of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Estebana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Estebana de la Concepción L. V. tiene la edad de 42 años, es una mujer casada. La actividad económica de Doña Estebana es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, ya que inicio para generar ingresos para su familia. Los propósitos de Estela para con su negocio son de darle al cliente lo que solicita ya que muchas veces, no posee los productos que sus clientes piden. Con el financiamiento que será utilizado para capital de trabajo comprara productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, café, detergente, gaseosas y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Estebana es convertir su pequeño establecimiento en una distribuidora y proporcionarles una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.name: Laura Lizethe

texts.es: Laura Lizethe T.  y su esposo Antonio de Jesús venden ropa nueva y usada en un lugar muy conocido de la ciudad. A esta actividad se dedican desde hace un año, esto lo hacen por que es una pareja que se caso muy joven, cuentan con un bebe esto hace que en su familia tengan mayor gastos por lo que con este proyecto tendrían mas oportunidad de sacar a delante a su hijo, además estudian la universidad y también requiere gastos de escuela y gastos de quien cuida a su hijo en lo que ellos estudian.

loans.use: Surtir Mercancia

loans.name: Melva

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MELVA ES MUY ANTIGUA ESTA EN SU CUARTA SECUENCIA, HA DEMOSTRADO SER UNA PERSONA MUY RESPONSABLE EN SUS PAGOS CON LA INSTITUCION, CON SU ANTERIOR GRUPO DEMOSTRO SER UNA PERSONA MUY SOLIDARIA CON SUS COMPAÑERAS, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE DULCES, GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, COMIDA Y OTROS, SU NEGOCIO ESTA DENTRO DE UN COLEGIO, RECIBE LA AYUDA DE SU ESPOSO, TAMBIEN TRABAJA PARA EL COLEGIO HACIENDO LA LIMPIEZA. VIVE EN CASA FAMILIAR.
texts.en:
Melva has spent a long time with Kiva´s partner organisation and is now in her fourth loan cycle. She has proven herself to be a very responsible person in regards to her payments to the institution, and with her previous group she proved herself to be very supportive to her colleagues. She sells sweets, biscuits, refreshments, food and other products in a college, and the loan that she is applying for will be used to purchase more of these products. She receives support from her husband, and she also works at the college as a cleaner. She lives in a house with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of refreshments, sweets, biscuits and other products

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Alejandro se dedica a la carpintería, hace muebles, puertas, ventanas y otros muebles de madera, desde hace un año y medio; el señor trabaja solo, vive en casa familiar con sus 6 hijos, el fue abandonado por la esposa, es decir que el atiende a sus hijos;  los hace estudiar y  los educa,  recien se junto a una señora  que es ama de casa, esta en su segundo crédito, donde demostró mucha responsabilidad en el cumplimiento de sus pagos.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MADERA

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: AUMENTO DE CAPITAL

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria tiene un puesto de venta de refresco de linaza y empanadas desde hace once años en la zona de san Carlos del mercado la cancha, esta sacando este crédito para la construcción de una habitación para volverla tienda de barrio en su domicilio y asi no tener que trasladarse para vender, todo el dia, sino unicamente en las mañanas; por las tardes atender en la tienda que esta construyendo. Ella esta separada, sus hijos ya son mayores pero les ayuda con los nietos, viven en casa de uno de sus hijos. Ella es muy trabajadora y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Victoria has had a stand for 11 years in the market district of San Carlos. She sells a traditional beverage made with flaxseed and empanadas. She is taking out this loan in order to build a place for a neighborhood shop in her home and, thus, not have to relocate all day in order to sell her products. Rather, she will only go to her market stand in the mornings. In the afternoons, she will attend to the shop she is constructing. Victoria is separated from her husband. Her children are already grown, but she helps them with her grandchildren. They live in the house of one of her sons. She is very hard working and responsible about making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a shop in her home

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mrs. Mean T., age 25, is married Mr. Sambath Hoeun, age 29. The couple has no children yet and lives their mother on an island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Mean T. and her husband have earned a living by buying vegetables grown in their village and transport to sell in Phnom Penh market. Mean is asking for a loan of $200 to purchase more vegetables for resale, she will able to keep continuing expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Angelino

texts.es: El señor Angelino C. vive en la  zona de Santa Rosa de Callapa junto a su esposa la señora Marina y sus 4 hijos. Angelino es carpintero hace veinte años y actualmente tiene su taller de carpintería en la zona de Pampahasi frente a Samapa. Él trabaja principalmente realizando puertas y marcos de puertas de madera cedro y laurel. Uno de los mayores anhelos de Don Angelino es apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan llegar a ser profesionales. Angelino y Marina son personas muy responsables con su familia y su trabajo. El crédito es para la compra de madera laurel y cedro por pies.

loans.use: COMPRA DE 600 PIES DE MADERA CEDRO Y 100 PIES DE MADERA LAUREL

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: Loem T., 40, is a rice farmer and currently lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. Without the farm work, Loem T. also makes and sells snack cake to neighbors or passers-by in the village. She is married, but divorced her husband, and has two school-aged children, who are dependent on her income. Loem T. said that she hopes to own a shop, which she will use to attract the customers to buy her cake. That is why she requested a loan to build a small shop.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn C., 31, and her husband, Soeun Seng, 30, live on an Island of Mekong River, which is about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have three sons and one of them studies in a local school and other two are still young.

Simorn has been a silk weaver for fifteen year-old. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then in turns it to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a construction worker and is a weaver as well.  

Simorn has applied for a loan from Kiva through Maxima for one time already. She now is requesting another loan again of $200 to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for continuing her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for continuing her weaving business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa L. is from the village of Capucao Ozamiz City. She is 48 years old. Josefa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josefa owns & operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Josefa has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josefa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josefa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nemrod

texts.en:
Nemrod C. is from the village of Manabay Ozamiz City. He is 22 years old. Nemrod is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Nemrod owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Nemrod has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nemrod joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemrod is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies and buy baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nemrod from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family and save for future needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed, supplies and piglets

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra K. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Alejandra is single. To make a living, Alejandra owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alejandra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chap

texts.en: Chap P. is a 55-year-old local farmer and a widow with three children. Two of them are married and live separately and the third one is a student. To earn a living, Chap P. grows rice on her own small farmland. In the past, she paid much money to plow the farmland because she does not have enough farm supplies. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to buy a cow, which she will use to help plow her land.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Almira is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Almira owns & operates a retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Almira has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Almira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Almira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Almira is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Almira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle B. is from the village of Manabay Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Annabelle is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family and save for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the village of Dimalco Bonifacio in Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Gina is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dry goods in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. loans.name: Monte Rancho Group

texts.es: Es un grupo muy responsables en sus pagos, viven  en una zona muy alejada D. la ciudad, se conocen bien, no cuentan con servicios basicos, por ejemplo D. alcantarillado, agua potable, etc. Su grupo se llama "MONTE RANCHO", donD., el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 5º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Rosa L. D. C. ,ella es muy responsable y lider D. su grupo, tiene 3 hijos es casada su esposo y ella trabajan en su carpinteria. Como tesorera esta la socia Patricia S. V.  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo tiene 3 hijos es casada, el credito lo utiliza para  aumento D. capital en su tienda D. barrio. Como secretaria esta la socia Felisia C. M. es casada tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es albañil y ella elabora y venD. salteñas (empanadas) ambulando, el credito lo utiliza para mejoramiento del mismo.
texts.en:
This is a group that is very responsible with their payments. They live in an area very removed from the city and know each other well. They don't have basic services (sewer system, potable water, etc.) where they live. The group is called "Monte Rancho" ("Mountain Ranch) and is in its fifth loan cycle with its community bank. The group's board of directors consists as follows: Rosa is the president, and she is very responsible and the leader of the group. She is married, has three children and works in her carpentry shop. The treasurer is Patricia, who is also a very responsible mother of three children and is knowledgeable in the handling of money. She will use the loan to raise capital for her neighborhood store. The secretary is Felisia, who is a married mother of three children. Her husband is a construction worker, while she makes and sells empanadas outdoors. She will use the loan to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working captial

loans.name: Alejandra Maria

texts.es: La señora Alejandra vive en  la Av. Octavio Campero en la zona San Antonio, y se dedica a la venta víveres que reparte a crédito. Su esposo, Juan Apaza, trabaja en una empresa delimpieza. Ellos tiene 2 hijos pequeños en edad escolar. Alejandra es una persona muy responsable ya que por las mañanas trabaja ayudando a su suegra en la venta de pescado frito y los fines de semana ella vende en el mismo puesto Wallake (el wallake es la sopa de pescado con hierbas aromaticas acompañado de papa) y en algunas ocaciones también se dedica a la costura. Ya que ella esta trabajando hace varios meses con los víveres ya conoce de este negocio y solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, fideo y aceite que son los productos que más reparte. Uno de los mayores deseos de Alejandra es hacer crecer su negocio y apoyar a hijos para que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives on Octavio Campero Street in the San Antonio district and sells groceries which she distributes on credit. Her husband, Juan Apaza, works for a cleaning business. They have two small school-aged children. Alejandra is a very responsible person since in the morning she helps her mother-in-law sell fried fish and on the weekends she sells wallake at the same stand (wallake is a fish soup with herbs and potatoes) and on some occasions she also works as a seamstress. Since she has been selling groceries for many months, she is already familiar with this business and is requesting a loan in order to purchase rice, noodles, and oil, which are the products that she sells most. One of Alejandra's biggest desires is to grow her business and to support her children so that they become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles, and oil

Her husband is employed in a private company, earning approximately an income of US $7 in revenue per day, which they use to cover their household expenses. This primary source of income helps his family a lot. This couple tries to work hard every day for the sake of their child. S. is seeking to improve her standard of living by starting another business, so she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase animal food for her pigs. By doing so, she hopes that she will be able to generate more income.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S., 29, is married and lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She decorates handicrafts. Since 1999, she has been using beads and other materials to decorate clothes with flowers, typically making US $1.50 each day. She decorates Khmer traditional dresses, which people wear during the Water Festival, P’chum Ben or the Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress; the price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer handmade to machine manufactured. She learned how to decorate from her mother and has been doing it since before her marriage. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who is able to make a living about US $2 every day. Chem S. is asking for a loan of US $600, with which she will purchase more silk and beads she can use to expand her business.

loans.use: purchasing more silk and beads

loans.name: Dương's Group

texts.en: A. Dương Thị (20213010011) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc N.. A. is the group leader of a five-member group loA. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives A. individual loA., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is A. N. 04 (4). A. is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2008, A. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loA. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. A. is now requesting a new loA. of 6,048,000 VND which will again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loA. will be her 3rd loA. from SEDA. A. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. Đỗ Thị M. (20213010012) is a 26-year-old male who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loA. to support his furniture-making business. 2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20213010014) is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 6,048,000 VND loA. to support her business making and selling food. 3. Nguyễn Thị N. (20213010013) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010015) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loA. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** A. Dương Thị (20213010011) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc N.. A. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là A. N. 04 (4). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương. A. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, A. kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2008, A. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. A. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,704,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Đỗ Thị M. (20213010012) là 26 tuổi nam. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. 2. Nghiêm Thị M. (20213010014) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6,048,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Nguyễn Thị N. (20213010013) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Nguyễn Thị H. (20213010015) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than Thol, 50, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province to earn approximately around US$3 each day, while her husband, Khit Nob, stays at home making brooms for her. Broom is made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make broom from their neighbors and they start doing that business since 1995. This couple has one school-aged child. Than told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$60 on food and US$5 on utility. Than is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase a motorbike she needs to transport brooms to sell at the market.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario O., from the village of Magsaysay , Misamis Oriental, is a 32-year-old married father of an infant. To make a living, Dario owns and operates a specialized retail store whose main source of income comes from buying and selling fruits such as bananas and coconuts in the local community. In business for over two years, he earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. This will be Dario's second loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon C. is 23 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker nearby her house. She typically makes about US$2 every day, while her husband is a clothe seller at the local market. On average, he is able to make US$4 of profit. This couple has two young children. Chuon is asking for a loan of US$600 her husband needs to expand his clothes’ inventory.

loans.use: To expand his clothes’ inventory.

loans.name: Yarnn

texts.en: Yarnn S., 29, pictured here, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province; he earns approximately around US $3 each day while his wife, Chhuon Pab, stays at home making brooms for him to sell at the market. The brooms are made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife learned how to make brooms from their neighbors and they started doing that business in 2005. This couple has three young children. Yarnn told a loan officer that every month his family needs to spend around US $75 on food and US $5 on utilities. Yarnn is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, in order to purchase long grass to make more brooms.

loans.use: purchasing long grass to make more brooms

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is the proud owner of MarieDenee.com, an online boutique selling plus-sized women’s clothing to a clientele that Marie describes as “curvy, confident, and chic”.

Marie and her sister were raised by a single mom in the military. The first in her family to go to college, Marie even went on to pursue a Master’s in business administration. “Right when I finished college, a trend started in my family - my uncle, my mom and my aunties all went back to school.”

After finding her passion for the world of fashion, Marie worked as a manager for a large department store. Marie loved her job, but she was laid off in 2008. Strengthened by the sense of independence and adventure she gained while being raised in the military, Marie turned to self-employment to make ends meet. She launched MarieDenee.com in September, 2009 and runs the whole operation out of her apartment. “When I was first laid off, I didn’t know how I was going to make my rent. Life gave me lemons, and I decided to make lemonade!”

A $7,500 loan will allow Marie to invest in a system to better organize her inventory as well as increase the number and type of items she can offer her customers. “I have a booming business that grew out of my bedroom and this loan will help me to organize method to my madness. I made my dream come to fruition. It took faith to learn how to trust my own strength. I’m proud, but I’m excited because this is just the beginning!”

Visit  http://www.mariedenee.com.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory items and a system to better organize her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Rours

texts.en: Rours P. is 30 years old and resides with her husband in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been raising pigs and is able to make US $2 of profit every day. Her husband, Yuon Sok (pictured here) has a business making rice wine. He typically makes about US $2.50 each day. This couple has two young children. Rours P. would like a loan of US $500 so that her husband can purchase more rice to make rice wine.

loans.use: producing rice wine

Broom is made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make broom from their neighbors and they start doing that business since 2008. She told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$30 on food and US$5 on utility. She is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase a motorbike she needs to transport brooms to sell at the market.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin R., 36, has a business selling brooms at the local market of Takeo province to earn approximately around US$4 each day, while her husband, Nhor Nuk, pictured here, stays at home making brooms for her. Broom is made from a kind of long grass which grows in the forest. Both husband and wife know how to make broom from their neighbors and they start doing that business since 2000. This couple has five children, four of who are in school and one is too young to attend. Chin R. told to a loan officer that every month she needs to spend around US$45 on food and US$3 on utility. She is asking a loan from Kiva via Credit, local partner, to purchase long grass to make more brooms to sell at the market.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok R., 28, lives with his wife and one young child in the Takeo province. They both work in a garment factory. Additionally, his wife, San Chreb, also raises pigs to earn extra income and thus raise their standard of living. Combined, they typically make about US $2 of profit every day. Sok R. is asking for a loan of US $600 so that his wife can raise more pigs. (Sok’s wife is pictured at home.)

loans.use: raising pigs

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel R., from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis, Oriental, is 38 years old and single. To make a living, Noel owns and operates a specialized retail store whose primary income is derived from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offerings, he is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to further expand product offerings. This loan will be Noel's second from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem P., 30, lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She usually purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. On average, she makes US$2 of profit every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a cow dealer who is able to earn a living of US$3 each day. Nhem P. is asking for a loan of US$600 her husband needs to purchase more cows to resell.

loans.use: Raise cows.

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: Thaong P. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a garment factory worker who is able to make US $2 of profit each day; her husband, Nov Dy (pictured here) stays at home making and selling brooms at the local market. He typically makes about US $4 of profit each day. Thaong P. would like to take out a loan of US $800 so that her husband can purchase a motorbike, with which he can transport brooms to the market.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Top

texts.en: Top V., 52, is a widow with one of her children and resides in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been selling boil beans at the local market and is able to make US$2 of profit every day. She is also aided by her daughter who works as garment factory worker, earning US$2 per day. Top V. would like to take out a loan of US$300 so that she can sell huge amount when the ceremony take place in her village.

loans.use: To purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
T. Lê Thị is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông 1 (1).

T. is married and has three adult children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 Vietnamese dong a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Hoàng Thị M. is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. Lê Thị N. is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.

3. Lê D. Dị is a 50-year-old male who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4. Lê D. S. is a 34-year-old male who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support his business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5. Vũ Thị H. is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

========================================

T. Lê Thị (20209010006) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông 1 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thực phẩm chiên trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các D.ch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Hoàng Thị M.  (20209010007) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Lê Thị N. (20209010008) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


3.  Lê D. Dị (20209010009) là 50 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Lê D. S. (20209010010) là 34 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


5.  Vũ Thị H. (20209010011) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các D.ch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên D.ch. .  Do việc biên D.ch thủ công các D. mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santa Cruz Palmita Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santa Cruz Palmita, este es un grupo formado por 10 mujeres y un caballero, éste grupo se encuentra en la sierra del estado de Guerrero, y se encuentra a una hora de la ciudad más cercana que es Cruz Grande.

La idea de crear un grupo para solicitar un crédito fue de la señora Angela, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de pan, pero necesita un crédito para comprar materias primas, es por ello que se unieron y solicitaron un crédito para apoyarse en las distintas actividades que cada uno de ellos tiene. 

Angela vive en unión libre y se dedica a realizar panes, sin  embargo a veces los pedidos que tiene no los puede surtir, por que no tiene suficiente materia prima, es por ello que solicita un préstamos para comprar harina, huevo, levadura, etc, en cantidades mas grandes, pues de eesa manera es más barato.

Los demás integrantes del grupo desean tambien hacer incrementar sus negocios, ellos se dedican a distintas actividades; ARELI vende tamales,BONFILIA vende pescado, TERESA vende productos de plástico para el hogar, como cubetas; MARILU vende perfumes,CARMELA tiene una tienda de abarrotes,CLARA vende pollos,VICTOTRINA vende carne,MARIBEYDA tiene una tienda de abarrotes, LUIS ALBERTO tiene una panadería y NELY G. vende comida.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima como levadura, harina, etc

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia R. is a widow and mother from the village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. She is 60 years of age and gifted with seven children. She has been in her retail business of selling goods in her general store in their village for ten years. Being a widow mother is difficult, but Arsenia is still lucky because when her husband died, her children are already adults and had finished their studies.

Even though she is living by herself, she still wants to have other sources of income. Living without her partner is lonely, but she is still trying her best to move on and survive for future emergencies and her grandchildren. Looking for another source of income is not easy to do if there is not enough capital to build up. She wants to improve her business by borrowing additional capital amounting to 7,000 PHP from KIVA lenders to buy additional grocery items to sell to be able to gain more profit.

loans.use: additional capital to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Amamadine Khoja Parsa Group

texts.en: Bibi Jan is the group leader of Amamadine Khoja Parsa group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for their business. The requested a group loan of 20000 Afghani.Bibi Jan wants to take a loan for her business of leather sewing. Also M. Hamaun wants to take a loan for his business of general store. And Amamadine wants to take a loan for his business of taxi driver. They are very happy with this small loan in Afghanistan thanks all lender of AFSG and Kiva processes in this poor city

loans.use: they make larger their business

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa G. is a 42-year-old and lives with her husband and children in Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a carpenter and her eldest son is a university student in the State University of Mongolia in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Bolormaa has a small retail business selling vegetables. She mostly sells locally-grown vegetables in the local food market, where she rents a small stall and sells produce that she purchases from local gardeners. She mostly purchases potatoes from Khovd, a neighbor province where many people grow vegetables. She started her vegetable retailing business in 1999 and since then, her business has expanded: her business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 2,000,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). She says that her business is the main source of income to pay her son's university tuition. She hopes to expand her business and secure tuition money for her son from business profits. She requests a loan to purchase more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C. is 47 years old, married to Eddie C. who is 52 years old now. They are blessed with five children; three of them are working in Manila and two are presently studying. Her children in Manila are helping her when she has emergency needs. But when her children need tuition fees during their examinations, she has to look for someone else to borrow money from. Their yield in their farm is insufficient to sustain her children's needs in the whole school year.

From her experiences, she knows that sending her children in school is difficult if she doesn’t have an extra source of income. Now, she has learned from her experiences. For five years now, she has been engaged in a hog raising business. This business helps her provide her children's tuition payments during their examination. When she is in need of financial assistance, she sells her pigs. At present she has insufficient funds for maintaining the feed levels of her pigs. In this situation, she is asking the KIVA lenders to loan the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley L. is from the village of Gingoog. She is 34 years old. Shirley is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Shirley owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and sometimes fruit juices in the local community. Shirley is just starting this business.

In 2009, Shirley joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Shirley from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store.

loans.name: Hanan Jawed Group

texts.en:
Hanan is the group leader of Hanan Jawed group. There are three members in this group.  

All of them would like to receive money for his own business, as they want to expand said businesses. 
 
Hanan and B. Z. want to take a loan for their business of building services in order to improve it. Also, M. Jawad wants to take a loan for his general store, in order to attract more customers. They thank all lenders, Kiva, and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel B. is from the village of Gingoog. She is 40 years old. Raquel is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Raquel owns  and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Raquel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raquel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raquel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering at her store. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raquel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

texts.en:
"H. Hoàng Thị (20209010013) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

loans.name: Togoohuu

texts.en: T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his children, ages 15 and 13, attend a local secondary school. T. operates a taxi service and a coal transportation service in his town. After operating a consumer goods business for five years, he began his delivery service in 2008. T. says “All I want is to be able to educate my children and make them better people who can contribute to society.” He is requesting  a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to purchase repair parts for his delivery truck.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts for his delivery truck

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel L. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Maricel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
