loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy repair parts for his car

loans.name: Nyambuu

texts.en:
Nyambuu E. lives with his wife and 1-year-old son in Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and the capital of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their son.

E. operates an electronic appliance and cellphone repair service in the city. He has much skill in his trade and can repair a variety of electronic goods and cellphones. He operates mainly out of his rented office but also makes visits to his customers’ homes to make repairs.

E. started his business in 2005 after graduating from an electronics repair course. He has found much success and always looks to expand his business. His earnings have enabled him to hire two assistants and to register his business as a company, "Arshi Tenger" Co. Ltd. For the future, E. says, "I hope to one day own my own workspace."

E. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase tools and electronic parts for his repair business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and electronic parts for his repair business

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren G. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Gobi-Altai province in southwestern Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest daughter graduated from a pharmacy program in 2009 and now works for a popular Mongolian pharmacy chain. His youngest daughter is currently attending university and his youngest son goes to a local secondary school. G. operates a firewood-selling business at a local market in his town, with the help of his wife. He started his business in 2004 with working capital amounting to 300,000 tugrugs (about $210). The business is supported by the entire family and it has grown into a successful operation. Over the years, G. has used his earnings to expand his business and now sells coal in addition to firewood. Today, his working capital exceeds 3,000,000 tugrugs. For the future, G. says, "I would like to expand my business further by growing vegetables to sell." He is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more wood and coal for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and coal for his business

loans.name: Yondon

texts.en: Yondon B. is 35 years old and lives with his mother and younger brother in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates a gold and silver crafts business in his town. He has a great deal of skill as a craftsman. He both designs and produces a variety of jewelry and accessories. B. uses his car to collect orders directly from his customers and also delivers the finished product to them. B. started his business with the help of his oldest brother in 2000 after moving to his province's capital city. Since then, he has worked hard to grow his crafts business, and in 2005 he used his savings to begin renting a stall at the local market. He is always looking for ways to increase his sales, and hopes that one day he will have enough money to build his own house. In the near future, B. wants to create new original designs and begin crafting a wider variety of jewelry products. As the busy fall wedding season is underway in Mongolia, B. needs to purchase more raw materials to produce jewelry for the many brides. He is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase more gold and silver.

loans.use: To purchase more gold and silver for making jewelry.

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
"L. Chu Thị is 22 years old and lives in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh 1 - Nhóm 06 (6).

L. is married and has two infant-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a business of manufacturing and selling aluminum products to local businesses and community members.  L. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $260 a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which again will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.  This will be her third loan from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue that is generated to expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Nguyễn Thị T. is 55 years old. She is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

2.  Nguyễn Thị O. is 19 years old and is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.

3.  Nguyễn Thị X. is 31 years old. She is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

4.  Nguyễn Thị H. T. is a 24 years old and is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.

5.  Lê Thị T. is 44 years old. She is requesting a 3.360.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

6.  Chu Thị S. is 24 years old and is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L.  Chu Thị (20213010024) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là An Ninh 1 - Nhóm 06 (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng nhôm cho các dO. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L.  thực hiện công việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L.  kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, L.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị T.  (20213010063) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Nguyễn Thị O. (20213010027) là 19 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành công việc kinh dO. quần áo.


3.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20213010028) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Nguyễn Thị H. T. (20213010023) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  Lê Thị T. (20213010025) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.360.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là kinh dO. cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


6.  Chu Thị S. (20213010062) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

texts.en: Sadeqa the leader of Zamra group. The group lives in District 4, Kabul, Afghanistan, and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 40,000 AFN. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Sadeqa and Sharefa request a loan for their tailoring business. Zamra requests a loan for her husband’s business of selling fresh fruit, and Banafsha wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of selling gas. They admire this process and want to thank Kiva, too.

loans.use: To grow their businesses

loans.name: Naomi Cheptarus

texts.en:
Naomi is 47 years old, married and is blessed with six children. Her clothing business is located at Chembulet in Eldoret.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan Naomi is expecting from KADET she intends to add more clothes for sale for both adults and children and for both genders. 

Her future dreams are to open a food kiosk so that she can have financial sustainability.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more readymade clothes for both adults and children.

loans.name: Bulgamaa

texts.en: Bulgamaa D. is a 30-year-old widow living in Bayanhongor aimar, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband passed away a few years ago and now she lives with her 12-year-old son who is a 6th grade student in a local secondary school. Bulgamaa sells various food products in a small stall that she rents in a local market. She has been in the food retail business since 2000 when she first bought a small container - a place to hold her products to sell to the locals. Since her start in 2000, she has been successful, and her small business is the only source of income for her family. With her business profit, she was able to purchase a small piece of land, on which she currently lives with her son.  In the future, she hopes to build a small store where she would be able to sell her food products. She requests a loan to build up inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products for her business

loans.name: Earlou Rey

texts.en:
Earlou Rey R. is from the village of Barangay 6, Gingoog City. He is 26 years old, is married, and has one infant child.

Earlou Rey owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling fruit "lanzones" in the local community. He has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Earlou Rey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Satare Kahkashan Group

texts.en:
Sedeqa is the group leader of Satare Kahkashan group. There are four members in this group. All of them want to receive money for their business.
Sedeqa and Sallema want to take a loan for their business of tailoring. They want to buy a new machine for their business. Also Sameya wants take a loan for her business of weaver. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business. Sharifa wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to complete her stock. They are requesting a loan in the amount of 56,000 Afghani.
With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families in future.

loans.use: they are expand and progress for their business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia D. is 28 years old. She is an ordinary villager of Barangay Bantay Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Rico who works as a house carpenter in their village and sometimes he is hired for farm work. Her husband does not have a regular job, and that is why Amalia is working hard to grow her hog-raising business to assist him to earn income for their livelihood.

At the moment, the couple has two children; they are currently in grade school. Amalia wants them to finish a degree someday. Amalia also manages a small store where she gets daily income for their basic needs. Her desire to have a successful business drives Amalia to request a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. This amount will be of great help towards the maintenance and improvement of her two businesses.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 32-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Hicham has owned a barber shop for over ten years. Hicham is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and his clients like him. His clients are mainly people from his region, but he also receives tourists. Hicham requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop; he wants to make it more modern and more attractive.

Hicham has been a micro-credit client for seven years now and has always repaid on time. His previous loans helped him maintain his work when there were hard times, as well as always improving his business. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to establish his shop. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, and he also wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop

loans.name: Mahmmoud

texts.en:
Mahmmoud is a 38-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Mahmmoud has been working as a furniture and house painter. Mahmmoud is special in his work because his is trustful in his work. His clients are people from and outside his region.

When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience, as well as because he wanted to have an independent job, but most importantly because he likes what he does.

Mahmmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint for his work. This is his second loan cycle and he has repaid on time. In the future, he plans on further improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint for his work.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 45-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. Ali has owned a grocery store for fourteen years. He sells canned food, candies, biscuits, soft drinks and juices, sanitary products and lots more. Ali is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients and offers a wide range of products. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others.

Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to expand his stock. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Ali has been working as a shoe and handbag repairer since 1995. Ali is special in his work because he is the only one in his region, and also, this kind of business isn’t found much anymore. His clients are people from and outside his region; people come from everywhere since his business is rare nowadays.

Ali requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to repair his sewing machine. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To  repair his sewing machine.

loans.name: Dori

texts.en:
Dori is a 23 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon. Dori has owned a clothing shop for three years. Dori sells men’s clothes like jeans, t-shirt, shirts, belts and even men accessories. Dori is special in his work because he is known for his merchandise’s good quality, as well as he has competitive prices. His clients can be anybody from his region. Dori requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop for the winter collection. This is the first time that Dori has requested a loan.
When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. He decided on doing his business because wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop for the winter collection.

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
Anania P. is 54 years old and she is engage in business retailing of goods in her general store at their village of San Rafael, Aurora, Isabela. She is a widowed mother 27 years ago, almost half of her life. They are blessed with five children with her late husband. Her two children have their own families and three of them are also working in Manila. Being alone is not the hindrance for being hopeless. In her situation, she doesn’t need to look for source of income because she already has her children giving her money for her food.

Anania still looks for source of income aside from farming for her future. She does not want look forward to her children remittances. She wants to work for her own because she understands that her children have their own families to support. She wishes to continue operate her business and improve for her source of income. She is asking from the KIVA lenders to help her improve her business by borrowing the amount of Php 22,000 for additional capital of her business.

loans.use: additional capital for her store business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
A. is a 41 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. A. has been working as a car electrician. He also sells cars accessories like batteries, lights etc. A. is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. 
A. requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cars electricity products. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase cars electricity products.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry D. is from the village of Maanas, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Cherry owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Cherry is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng C., 30, is married with two school-aged children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she has a business weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of $3 per day in revenue. Also, with her available time from weaving, she is involved in the agriculture sector as a rice field farmer to earn extra income. Her husband helps her with her craft and raises pigs for resale, earning an income of $3 per day. This couple is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase more silk to expand the craft business. C. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: To buy silk to expand the business

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is already widowed for three years. She is now 43 years old and she is living together with her four children.  She is still sending her two younger children in elementary school that’s why she tries her best to work well with her business. According to Rosalinda, she has to accept that she is now alone in her responsibilities of being a parent. She still hopes that her children could uplift their own lives someday, and she is still there to help them achieve their aspirations.

	Rosalinda has been engaged in retail business in their village. She had her business improved since she availed loan from KIVA lenders. Now, she is again requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP6,000 for additional revolving capital to grow her business. She is hoping that her business will further expand for more gains. Her income will be of great benefit for the educational needs of her two studying children.

loans.use: additional capital to grow her store business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira M. is from the village of Maanas, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Elvira owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phạm's Group

texts.en:
"H. Phạm Thị (20213010064) is a 51 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is An Ninh 2 (12).


H. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.186.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị X. (20213010065) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing waste management services.


2.  Đào Thị T. (20213010066) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a manufacturing business.


3.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20213010067) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


4.  Vũ Thị H. (20213010068) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  Dương Thị

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Rem C., 35, is married with five children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in the agriculture sector of growing few types of vegetable and selling her products at a local market, earning an income of US $5 per day in revenue. Her husband provides services of plowing farmlands for people in his village to grow vegetable, earning an income of US $3 per day. This couple is asking for a loan of US $800 to rent a plot of farmland to grow more vegetables. C. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: rent a plot of farmland

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina T. is from the village of Badjangon Springs, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old, is married and has three school-aged children. Rosalina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bol

texts.en: Bol H., 48, is a widow and has three children. She resides with her children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she is engaged in weaving Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of US $2.66 per day in revenue. Cambodian traditional method of producing weaving products is difficult and consumes long time to manufacture best outputs. The family is also assisted by one of her children who is currently working in a local garment factory, earning an income of US $2 per day. She is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more silk and bean seeds to grow. H. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plan of investment to expand her business is successful.

loans.use: buy silk and bean seed

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok A., 47, is married with seven children. She resides with her husband and children in Sa Ang, Cambodia. To make a living, she raises pigs for sale, earning A. income of $8 per day in revenue. Her husband is also involved in the agriculture sector, growing rice and fruit trees and earning A. income of $4 per day. This couple is asking for a loA. of $800 to purchase feed so that the pigs grow efficiently. Sok A. hopes that her standard of living will be improved when her plA. of investment in her pigs is successful.

loans.use: To buy feed

loans.name: Akpos

texts.en: E. has poultry and sells birds. She is 34 years old and married with three children. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more poultry birds to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 52-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Ali has worked as a house painter for 35 years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint for his work and help fund his son’s trip. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
People from his region know Ali well because he is has a good reputation. His clients are people from his region. When Ali first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties since he has a good network. He decided on doing his business because he liked it. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase paint and help fund his son’s trip.

loans.name: Flora Jepkorir

texts.en:
Flora is 45 years old, married to Michael Kipkemoi and blessed with six children. She operates a clothes selling business at Chembulet in Eldoret.

Flora was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a member of her current group. With the loan, Flora  intends to add more clothing stock since this is the peak season.

In the future, Flora intends to expand her business and educate her children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 37 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife. Haytham has owned a women clothing shop. He sells t-shirts, dresses, shorts and women’s accessories. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop now that the winter season has approached. This is his fifth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his shop by diversifying his merchandise. Haytham is special in his work because he has competitive prices and has a wide range of choice. His clients are mainly his friends, neighbors and passer-bys. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulty. Haytham decided on doing his business because he took after his family’s business and before he used to help his father. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by selling men’s clothes.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Bassam has been working as a hairdresser for the last 10 years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for his salon and pay the school tuition of his children. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his salon by changing the décor and purchasing new seats. Bassam is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are mainly his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition. Bassam decided on doing his business because he had to work in order to improve his family’s financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening another shop.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon and pay the school tuition of his children.

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their seven children. Samia owns a grocery store. She sells canned food, candies, bread, home products, soft drinks, juices and lots more. Samia is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her diversify her store merchandise. 
When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Samia decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans to expand her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is married. She has two adult children who live separately. Leonora sells women's and children's shoes at Ilona Market in Mukachevo town. She has been in this business for 10 years. Leonora has a conservative approach to the type of inventories she sells and does not think it is good for her to begin selling new types of inventories, especially being this old. She has a stable small business that brings her not a large but a stable income. Leonora would like to borrow 5,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to receive additional income to offer her children some financial help.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Samwel Okoth

texts.en:
Samwel A. is 45 years old, married and he has two children. He operates a blacksmith business at Ngara street in Eldoret town.

He was introduced to KADET by a group member. Samwel has applied for a loan which she intends to use to improve his metal business by buying tools which include a new plate for his machine, welding rods, angle irons and square tubes. 

In future he intends to diversify to selling ready made goods and also be able to educate his children.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying more tools for his business

loans.name: Danny

texts.en: Danny is an active farmer from Agusan Del Sur. At 43, he now has three children with his wife. Rice farming is where he gets his income and he works hard to feed his family and meet their daily needs. Danny is a new member of CEV and he is thankful for the financial services he can now avail from the organization. He requested a loan of PHP 6,000. He will use this loan to purchase farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 49 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband. Nada has been owned a grocery store since 1988. She sells canned food, candies, bread, home products, soft drinks and juices, fruits and vegetables and lots more. Nada is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and offers a big variety of products. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Omar has requested a loan.
When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she took after her son’s work. Actually, her son lives abroad and that’s why she decided to work and to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en: 38-year-old Lorenda G. is a rice farmer. She is married and has two children, with the eldest being 13 years old. Lorenda owns rice fields and some of her crops are already flowering while some are only a month old. Short of finances, she requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. This loan will be used to purchase the items Lorenda needs for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase items needed for the farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en: Ferdinand is a hard-working farmer from Agusan Del Sur. He is 33 years old and still single. His rice crop is starting to grow but still needs inputs like fertilizer to continue growing. Ferdinand is a new member of CEVI and in his opinion, CEVI’s program is very helpful to him and his fellow farmers. Add to that, the benefits they can receive through the insurance service. For his first loan, he requested PHP 6,000. He will use this loan to acquire the farm inputs he needs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 37 years old, is married to Pauline Wangeci, and they have one school-going child. Peter has been running a bakery shop in Ndunyu Njeru town, in the outskirts of Naivasha town, for the last six years. Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan to diversify his source of income by buying a motorbike which he will operate as a taxi. In future, he plans to expand both businesses and have a stable source of income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Arnelo

texts.en: Arnelo has been married to his wife, Julie, for 6 years now. They have 1 child who is 5 years old. He owns a hectare of rice field and this is where he gets income to feed his family and meet their other needs. Arnelo joined CEVI to avail of its financial service because he admits he currently lacks the capacity to provide financing for his farm. He requested to loan Php6, 000, which he will use to buy what his rice field needs to grow healthy and produce good harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr: A. Zénabou est née vers 1957 à Bassila au Nord au Bénin. Mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés, Zénabou habite le quartier Vodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Zénabou  est revendeuse de divers articles de grande consommation (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, lait, piles, savons, igname etc.). Zénabou achète ses divers articles à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin, et au Nord du Bénin.  Zénabou revend l’igname en gros ou en détail à des clients à Cotonou. Zénabou a déjà reçu trois crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité et faire face à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Zénabou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Zénabou envisage plus tard construire une maison qu'elle mettrait en location.
texts.en:
Zénabou A. was born around 1957 in Bassila in northern Benin. She is married with three children currently in school and she lives in the Vodjè district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Zénabou sells various consumer goods (canned goods, pastas, milk, batteries, soap, yams, etc.). She buys these goods at Dantokpa, an international market in Benin, as well as in northern Benin. Zénabou sells yams wholesale or retail to customers in Cotonou. She has already received three loans with Alidé that were repaid in full. Zénabou is requesting a fourth loan so she can make her business more profitable and meet her customers' demands. Zénabou hopes to eventually build a house that she will rent out.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 20 sacks of yams

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a 50-year-old married woman with four children aged between 8 and 28 years. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Annet works in semi-urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. She is a tailor in Nsooba, sewing and selling clothing. She buys her clothing materials from shops in Kiyembe that sell clothing materials at a cheaper price. They are some of the busiest shops in Uganda. She pays for transport costs to and from shopping.

Annet is faced with the challenge of the increasing prices of clothing materials. She pays rent for her business premises at 45000/=. She sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale and works seven days a week. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group members.

Annet wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a tailoring school.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Mrs. Minda D. is a 27-year-old married woman. She and her husband have a seven-year-old child. Minda works hard on her farm to earn a living and provide for her family. Fortunately for her, her rice crops are growing well. Aiming for a good and plentiful harvest, Minda needs soil amendments like fertilizer to realize her goal.

A new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), she is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP. This loan will really help Minda and her family achieve their needs.

loans.use: To buy soil amendments such as fertilizer

loans.name: Annah Ngipeto

texts.en:
Annah Ngipeto is 36 years old and married with three children. She oprates a saloon business which is located at Iten market and her major customers are people living within Iten.

She was introduced to KADET by a fellow group memeber who is also a client. She has applied for a loan which she intends to buy equipments for her saloon and different types of weaving hair to be able to cater for the different clients who are served from her stall.

Her dreams are to buy salon related items for sale in the Iten open air market.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy saloon equipment and weaving hair.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 47 year single mother of four children aged between 8 and 12 years. All her children go to school .She resides and owns a four roomed house where she stays with six people  Rose takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Rose works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She is a tailor in Ndeeba, selling charcoal and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping as she buys directly from producers in the villages She is faced with the challenge of transportation because when it rains the roads becomes impassable.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays monthly market dues. Rose sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works seven days a week  She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for seven years servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more airtime cards. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning delivery vans

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Originaire d'Abomey, ville historique du Bénin, A. Antoinette est née vers 1947 à Savè au Nord du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à LISSA Placide, un agent retraité des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin, et a six enfants tous scolarisés. Cela fait plus de douze ans que Antoinette exerce le commerce de charbon de bois. Antoinette achète le charbon de bois au Nord du Bénin et le revend à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Antoinette a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu'elle a eu à ALIDé antérieurement. Pour accroître son stock actuel  et diversifier son activité par la vente de maïs, Antoinette sollicite un troisième crédit à ALIDé. Antoinette espère ainsi mieux tirer profit de son commerce.

loans.use: Achat de  charbon de bois et de maïs

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem L. is 23 years old and resides in the Takeo province with her husband, Hory Yart. She works in a shoe store, making approximately $21 in revenue, while her husband earns $8 each day as a mechanic. Sem L. is asking for a loan of $1,000 to diversify her grocery items to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To diversify grocery items

loans.name: Lilian Auma

texts.en:
Lilian O. is a 22-year-old married lady with three children. She operates a maize-roasting business in Junction on Iten Road.

Lilian was introduced to KADET by a fellow member. With the loan she is expecting from KADET, she intends to buy more stock for her business which includes maize for roasting and also firewood.

Her dream is to become a better business lady in Junction so as to improve her living standards.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more green maize and firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 60 year widowed with two children aged between 5 and 10. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with five people  Maria takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Maria works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She is a tailor on Lubaga Road selling airtime cards and the cards from telecommunication firms and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but as she works from her home. Maria sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works six days a week Maria  She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more airtime cards. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning fa video library and designing shop

loans.use: to buy more airtime cards

loans.name: Léonard

texts.fr: H. Léonard est né en 1973 à Abomey, une ville historique du Bénin. Marié, Léonard n’a pas encore d’enfant. Léonard a appris pendant trois ans la coiffure pour femme et l'exerce depuis près de quinze ans à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Léonard dispose d’un atelier au marché du quartier VEDOKO size à Cotonou. C'est pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et s’approvisionner en divers produits cosmétiques (shampooing, balsam, gel, produits défrisants et d'entretien des cheveux, etc.) que Léonard sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de divers produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut S., 28, is a professional decorates handicrafts living at home in the Phnom Penh. Since 2002, she been has using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living. She typically makes US$3 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Besides doing this business, she and her husband also work as farmers and sell chickens at the local market. Khut S. would like a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike she needs to transport chickens to sell at the local market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn is blessed to have her own rice field. She doesn’t need to tend another person’s farm like other farmers do.

At 33, Merelyn has four children with her husband of fifteen years. Her eldest child is only 15 years old.

Some of Merelyn’s rice crops are already flowering and still need to be supplied with farm inputs. She requested to loan Php 6,000 from CEVI. This loan will help her produce a good harvest and eventually help her family financially.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Rose Mary

texts.en: Rosemary is 33 year married with five children aged between 6 and 14. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with seven people  Rosemary doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water.   Rosemary works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She is a tailor on Lubaga Road and buys clothing materials from Owino market and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but as she works from her home. Rosemary sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works six days a week Rosemary before joining the sewing\tailoring business; she was dealing in locally made cold drinks. She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning fashion and designing shop

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S. is 27 years old and lives in the Takeo province with her husband. Since 2002, she has been working as a garment factory worker in the Phnom Penh city. On average, she is able to make US$2 every day, while her husband is a moto-taxi driver and makes US$3 per day. This couple has two children living at home to support. Chhuon Samphorts needs to take out a loan of US$700 her husband wants to purchase farm land. This will allows him to grow vegetables to sell at the market to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase farm land.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr: L. Michel habite à Womey, une agglomération périphérique de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Michel est marié et est père de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Michel est un guérisseur et un vendeur d'ossements d'animaux de tous genres. Il a été initié à cette activité pendant six ans et l'exerce depuis 1978 à Cotonou. Actuellement Michel est au cœur du marché VEDOKO à Cotonou où il a un stand. C'est pour renforcer son étalage en se ravitaillant en certains produits qui lui manquent actuellement qu'il a demandé un premier prêt à ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat d'ossements, peaux d'animaux et d'oiseaux

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en: Asiya is 57 year married with five children aged between 29 and 37 .None of her children go to school .She resides and owns a two roomed house where she stays with five people  The family has access to electricity and no piped water. Asiya works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  Asiya has a stall selling roasted maize on Lubaga Road and buys maize from Owino market  and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but only pays daily market dues. Asiya sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works seven days a week Joyce is faced with the challenge of seasonality when is no more maize she resorts to cassava and sweet potatoes. Asiya has been in this business for seventeen years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of maize and sweet potatoes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning whole sale shop..

loans.use: to buy more maize and sacks of cassava

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng S., 59, lives in Takeo province with her husband and three of her children. She has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about $3 in revenue each day. Her husband, Chan Nea, is a farmer who is able to earn $2 per day. The weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Chan Nea included. Heng S. is asking for a loan of $700 because her husband needs to purchase rice and take off the husks with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit.

loans.use: Sell rice

loans.name: Darng

texts.en: Darng S., 61, is married and lives with her two children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$1 each day, while her husband works as a motorbike mechanic and makes US$2 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Darng S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$500 that her husband needs to purchase some mechanic's tools.

loans.use: To purchase mechanic's tools.

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
Teo N. began brewing beer ten years ago. A widow, she has been the sole earner of her family for quite some time. Her success as a local brewer has allowed her to pay the school fees of her eight children. Teo is 50 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono.

Recently, Teo’s business has been going through difficult times because of perceived high prices of her products in this time of recession. Additionally some of her customers fail to pay their tabs. She is working on ways to bring prices down a bit and additionally is trying to establish a greater level of control over which individuals may start tabs. Teo is confident that her hardworking nature and willingness to adapt will allow for her continued success.

Teo would like to use the loan to expand her business through purchasing more brewing supplies.

loans.use: To buy more brewing supplies

loans.name: Andriy

texts.en:
Andriy is not married. He runs a small business that sells women's clothing. His parents started this business initially. Andriy decided to join it two years ago and opened his own location (he rents some space in a store). 
Andriy is a hard working, persistent, orderly and pleasant to talk person. He would like to develop this business as well as start some other business. He would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to purchase more women's clothing. He hopes to receive additional income and invest it back into business.

loans.use: to purchase inventories

loans.name: Hel

texts.en: Hel C., 55, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in the Takeo province. Two of their children are in school and the other two are motor-taxi drivers.She makes and sells banana cake in the community and is able to make about US$2 of profit every day, while her husband earns US$2 per day as a farmer. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has caused food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Hel C. included.  Hel C. is asking for a loan of US$600 she needs for her children to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.use: To operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long Y., 54, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer together with her husband and they typically make US$1.50 every day. They are also supported by their children who work in the garment factories, casino and blacksmith. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these times of economic difficulties, Long Y. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US$1000 to aid her son’s business. He currently works as a blacksmith, and could make a lot more money if he opened up his own shop. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful.

loans.use: Open up blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
Nhung T. N. is 54 years old. ( id: 010110060006). She lives in Phuc Tho – M. Lam –Dong Anh – Ha Noi. She sells soup noodL. in the morning. She is farming and breeding, too. She has three children. They were married. Mrs Nhung has got loans from Microfund organization for 3 years and repaid them on time. She has a monthly income of about 3.000.000 VND. This time, she wants to borrow 300 USD to breed the pigs and poultry.
 There are 3 other Fund participants in her group . 
 Anh T. H. M. was born in 1977. ( id: 010110060007).  She wants to borrow 285 USD to repair her house.
 Trang T. L. was born in 1983. ( id: 010110060010). She is young. She wants to borrow 285 USD to buy pigs to raise.
 Tam T. N. was born in 1977. ( id: 010110060009). She wants to borrow 225 USD to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to breed the pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun S., 33, is married and lives in Takeo province with her two children. She operates a grocery store, making around 3 USD each day, while her husband typically makes 2 USD every day as a worker. Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia, and many Cambodians have faced economic struggles.

Srun S. has approached CREDIT for a loan of 600 USD to reinvest in her grocery business. She would like to purchase groceries in bulk, which would save her money and be more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan N. is 25 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married with two children who are both currently enrolled in primary school. Even though she has only been running her clothing boutique for five months, she already generates from her business 60,000 USH per week. Susan believes her success thus far can be attributed to the excellent level of customer service that she offers to her customers.

Susan would like to use her loan to purchase more clothing for her boutique. Right now she lacks sufficient capital to keep up with high customer demand for her products. She hopes that as her business grows and becomes more profitable she one day will be able to afford building a house for her family.

loans.use: more inventory

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyen T. T. N. (id: 010110060004) is 27 years old and lives in Mai Lam, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has one chid. She is a worker and, besides that, she breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

She has obtained loans from micro-loan organizations for three years and has repaid on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approx. 285 USD) to buy food for her pigs.

There are two other participants in her group:

Huyen T. L. (id: 010110060003) is 27 years old. She has a store at her home and wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (approx. 305 USD) to invest in her store.

Phuong T. T. (id: 010110060005) is 23 years old and wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approx. 285 USD) to buy goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang K. lives in Pour village in Takeo province. She is a fruit seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. San Touch, is a pig breeder. Although this couple tries to work hard, they don't earn enough ncome to support the household. Now Mrs. Yeang K. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the fruits to sell. She is 53 years old and the mother of three children who are also fruit sellers. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: Is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to transport the fruits to sell.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin S., 24, is a low-income people and a local villager lives in the rural area of Battambang Province. Sin S. and her husband are local rice farmers. Beside their farm, they also weak up in early morning to buy fresh fish in bulk in which fishermen gathering and hurry bring those fishes to sell in retails at the market. This young couple has two kids who are dependent on their income. Sin S. hopes to generate additional income through operating a new suitable investment but she has not enough capital to begin. To help provide with capital, she has asked for a loan to build/decorate the size of business place and then to purchase disks to sell or rent out to her villager. With the remainder of the loan she will use to sustain her both businesses above.

loans.use: To build/decorate the size of business place and then to purchase disks to sell or rent out to her villager

loans.name: Saren

texts.en: Mrs. Saren V. is a villager in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a rice middle woman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Long Thay, is employed as commune development committee. This couple has a child who is a security guard in ACLEDA bank.

loans.use: By purchasing more rice to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.en:
D. Zarifjon is 36 years old. He is married with four children. Zarifjon is running the private small café where he cooks and sells the kebab. Five years ago Zarifjon started as the assistant cooking the kebab. Gradually he became so experienced in this that decided to open his own small café which is working already for two years. Zarifjon is planning to expand his café. Thus he need to increase the inventory, in other words to purchase coal and refrigerator for expanding his business. For all this Zarifjon requests $600 US Dollars. This is the first loan of Zarifjon. However, having the stable business he would like to ensure all that he is able to pay in time and to thank everyone for support.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Expanding of business and purchasing of inventory like coal and refrigerator

loans.name: Mutt

texts.en:
Mrs. Mutt S. is a villager in Pongro village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's lives with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Horn Hon, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchasing more ducks and duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina T. lives in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder and duck eggs seller. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks for breeding to make more duck eggs to sell. Her husband, Mr. Nget Savuth, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sina T. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: By purchasing more ducks for breeding to make more duck eggs to sell.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok A. is the group leader of five members who all live in Tboung Damrei village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Teang Hoy, is a security guard. Now Mrs. Sok A. is applying for a loan to buy household assets for her family. She is 40 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

Three members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy household assets for her family.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a hard-working person and over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to help her husband with family expenses. She is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and after fattening sells in the local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Mukaddas is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni for purchasing calves. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 44 year old divorced woman who lives in Beirut, capitA. of Lebanon and has five children. Mona has been working as a sewer for two years. Mona is speciA. in her work because of her experience and she can sew all type of clothes. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Mona requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase thread for her work and repair her sewing machine. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. 
When she first started her business, she was newly divorced and therefore had financiA. issues because she used to be a housewife. Mona decided on doing her business because of her experience, and especially because she needed to make her own living. In the future, she plans on having more clients in order to have a better income.

loans.use: To purchase thread for her work and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Nesrien

texts.en:
Nesrien is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Nesrien has owned a clothing shop for six years. She sells women and children’s clothes.

Nesrien is special in her work because of her experience; she knows how to please her clients and is aware of the fashion. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Nesrien requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

When she first started her business, she didn’t use to sell a lot and therefore, brought in less revenue. Nesrien decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales. In the future, she plans on improving her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Abed Elrahman

texts.en:
Abed Elrahman is a 30 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon. Abed Elrahman has owned a grocery store since 2007. He sells candies, raw materials, canned food, cheese, Nutella, oil, sauces etc. Abed Elrahman is special in his work because he owns a big variety of products. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store to increase his stock. This is the first time that Abed Elrahman has requested a loan.
When Abed Elrahman first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of cash. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening another grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Angelica Joao Da

texts.pt:
Angélica da C. é natural de Maputo tem 34 anos de idade casada e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre 13 a 26 anos destes os 2 mais novos ainda vão a escola e 2 mais velhos já casados. Frequenta neste momento a 12ª classe depois de ter interrompido na 6ª classe devido ao casamento precoce. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ela.

Ela nunca mudou de cidade, já a 24 anos que começou a trabalhar na DIC (Direcção Nacional de Identificação Civil) actualmente afecta na Matola rio e tem um salário mensal de 3.290.00mt. Consegue ainda poupar algum porque tem um outro rendimento proveniente da actividade comercial, cerca de 6.000.00mt por mes.

Nunca pediu empréstimos em outras instituições de crédito, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua irmã que também é cliente da mesma. Este é o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, chapas de zinco e outros, os valores anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt,13.000.00mt e 15.000.00 todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios que ela encara é o elevado custo de material de construção, assim pretende pagar bem o seu empréstimo para garantir os próximos créditos sem problemas para aceder a mais empréstimos no futuro com o objectivo de concluir a sua obra e comprar uma viatura.
texts.en:
Angélica da C. is from Maputo. She is 34 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 13 and 26. The two youngest still attend school and the two oldest are already married. She currently attends 12th grade, after having interrupted her education in the 6th grade, due to her early marriage. She lives in her own home, and besides her children, she also supports two grandchildren who live with her. Angelica never left the city. When she was 24 years old she began to work at the DIC (Directorate of Civil Identification). She currently works in Matola-Rio and earns a monthly salary of 3.290.00 MT. She manages to save a bit because she has additional income from business activities, around 6.000.00 MT per month. She has never requested a loan from other institutions. She learned about Hluvuku from her sister who is also a client. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 20.000.00 MT, which she plans to use to purchase cement, sheets of zinc, etc. Her previous loans were for 10.000.00 MT, 13,000.00 MT, and 15,000.00 MT, all for the same purpose. The challenge she faces is the high cost of construction materials. She therefore plans to pay her loan properly to guarantee future loans without problems, so that she can have access to future loans to complete construction and purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (sheets of zinc, cement, sand, etc. )

loans.name: Catarina

texts.pt:
Catarina S. nasceu no distrito da Manhiça Província de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade é casada, não tem filhos. Vive na casa própria em Boane e sustenta 3 sobrinhos que tem 10, 06 e 03 anos de idade dos quais 2 vão a escola. Fez 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais.

Em 1978 saiu de Manhiça para Boane devido a transferência do Marido pelos Serviços para aquele Distrito. Trabalha como auxiliar de cozinha no instituto pedagógico do Umbeluze em Boane a mais de 28 anos. Aprendeu esta actividade das colegas, neste momento aufere um salário de 2.480.00mt e o seu marido também é funcionário.

Conheceu a Hluvuku graças a sua vizinha que também é cliente da instituição e nunca pediu créditos em outras instituições.

Com o presente crédito de 17.000.00mt pretende comprar portas, cimento, ferro, mosaicos e outros para a conclusão da obra. Os seus empréstimos anteriores pagou sem problema e foram de 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, 15.500.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

No futuro pretende pedir mais empréstimos para construir dependências e bancas de aluguer.
texts.en:
Catarina S. was born in the Manhiça Province of Maputo. She is 47 years old, married, and has no children. She lives in her own home in Boane and supports three nephews who are 10, 6, and 3 years old, two of whom attend school. She attended school until the 7th grade but had to drop out due to her parents' financial situation. In 1978 she left Manhiça for Boane when her husband was transferred by the civil service to that district.
