She has worked as an assistant cook in the teacher's college of Umbeluze in Boane for more than 28 years. She learned her occupation from coworkers and currently earns a salary of 2.480.00 MT. Her husband is also a civil servant. She learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who is also a client. She has never requested a loan through other institutions. With this loan for 17.000.00MT, she plans to purchase doors, cement, iron, tile, etc. to complete construction. She paid her prior loans without any problems. They were in the amounts of 7.000.00MT, 10.000.00MT, 15,000.00MT and 20.000.00MT, all for the same purpose. In the future she plans to request loans to construct anexes and display tables for rent.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of contruction materials ( cement, iron, tile, etc.)

loans.name: Eria Francisco

texts.pt:
Eria Francisco C. é natural de Maputo cidade, capital de Moçambique, tem 34 anos de idade, casada e sem filhos. Vive na casa própria com 3 enteados e 1 sobrinho com idades entre 10 a 22 anos e todos vão a escola. Para alem de sua família ela sustenta seu irmão mais velho e sua sogra, enviando alguns produtos alimentares. Iniciou a estudar a 5 anos atrás porque antes não teve condições, neste momento frequenta 5ª classe e pretende continuar ate nível superior. 

Nunca sai de Maputo, é dona do próprio negocio a 7 anos e o seu marido é carpinteiro. Aprendeu a fazer comércio através de seu marido quando trabalhava numa pessoa que fazia negocio e tem esta experiência a mais de 12 anos.
Através do seu negócio consegue ter um rendimento aprox. 5.000.00mt por mês com qual ajuda no sustento da casa e poupa algum com as amigas no sistema tradicional (Xitique).     

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu marido e nunca solicitou empréstimos em outros bancos. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo nesta instituição no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar areia e cimento e outros (para fazer murro de vedação). Os valores anteriores foram de 5.200.00mt, 7.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.

Os desafios que enfrenta é o elevado custo de material de construção, mesmo assim não desiste de seu objectivo de ver sua casa vedada. No futuro pretende pedir mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Eria Francisco C. is natural from Maputo city, Mozambique's capital. She is 34 years old, married, and has no children. She lives in her own house with three stepsons and one nephew, who are between 10 and 22 years old and go all to school. Besides her family, she supports her older brother and her mother-in-law by sending them some food.

She has started to study 5 years ago because before that she didn’t have conditions to do so. At this moment, she is enrolled at the 5th grade and she intends to continue her studies up to higher education.

She never leaves Maputo. She has been owner of her business for 7 years. Her husband is carpenter. She learned how to do business from her husband when he worked with a businessman and she has more than 12 years of experience. Through her business, she is able to earn approximately 5,000.00 MZN per month, with which she helps with the household expenses and saves some money together with her friends by the traditional system (called Xitique).

She learned about Hluvuku through her husband and has never requested a loan at other banks. This is her 5th loan with this institution, of 15,000 MZN. The previous loans were 5,200 MZN, 7,000 MZN, 10,000 MZN and 12,000 MZN, and all of them were applied in the same activity.

The challenge she faces is the high cost of the construction materials. Even so, she does not give up on her goal to see her house finished. In the future, she intends to request more loans in order to conclude her house construction.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, sand and others)

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
Otabek is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Otabek hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.pt:
Jeremias N. é Natural de Boane, tem 35 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos com idades entre 7 a 16 anos de idade ambos vão a escola. Sua esposa é activista da Associação que lida com HIV SIDA (PFUKANE). Foi formado pelo Centro de Formação de Professores de Namaacha a19 Anos e no Instituto do Magistério Primário a 10 anos.

Vive na casa propria com sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém. Nunca mudou de cidade, e é funcionário Publico da Educação a mais de 19 anos auferindo um salário mensal de 4.383.00mt.

Já levantou um empréstimo no Banco comercial BIM, no valor de 24.000.00 para habitação (compra de material de construção).
Conheceu esta instituição através de amigos que são clientes da mesma a longa data.

Este é o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar areia, cimento, pedra, varões e outros e espera melhorar o aspecto da sua casa assim como, no futuro, solicitar mais crédito para concluir seus estudos e formar seus filhos.
texts.en:
Born in Boane, Jeremias N., 35, is married and the father of six children ages 7 to 16, all enrolled in school. His wife is an activist at Pfukani, an association engaged in the fight against HIV/AIDS in Mozambique. He graduated from the Center for Teachers' Education-Namaacha at the age of 19, and, at 25, from the Elementary Education Institute. Jeremias lives with his family in a house they own in Boane. He has been working as a public school teacher for 19 years, and his monthly salary is currently 4.383.00mt. He has had a loan with the Bank of Mozambique in the past, in the amount of 24.000,00 mt, which he used to buy construction material to build his house. He's learned about Hluvuku through friends who have been clients for many years, and this will be his first loan with the institution. He will use the 20.000.00 mt to buy cement, stones, steel bars and other material to invest on improving the facade of his house. He hopes to apply for other loans in the future, to continue his own studies and to make sure his children can stay in school until they graduate.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, stones, steel bars, etc)

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
S. Ibrogim is a very courageous man that is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising cattle and agriculture. He's the father of four adult children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need. In spite of his difficult economic situation and after much time, he has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of cattle to breed them on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family. It's for this reason that Ibrogim comes to IMON International for loans for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Armando Q. nasceu em Zavala, Distrito de Inhambane, província de mesmo nome e tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 27, 25, 12 e 10 anos de idade. Fés 8ª classe e não foi possível continuar com os estudos porque foi solicitado a cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório.
Vive na casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta a sua mãe em Zavala, enviando dinheiro e produtos alimentares.

Saiu de Zavala ainda criança com seus pais para o distrito de Boane, a procura de emprego e melhores condições de vida. Actualmente é dono de seu negócio a mais de 18 anos e conta com 3 trabalhadores. O produto que mais vende é a Cerveja, refrescos e vinhos. Aprendeu esta actividade através de seu falecido pai desde 1981.

Nesta actividade consegue render aproximadamente a 7.000.00mt e sempre poupa algum no Banco Comercial BIM. A esposa também é comerciante, vende roupa usada.

Teve alguns empréstimos com uma sociedade de crédito (SOCREMO), parou de levantar o crédito devido a várias razoes. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga que também é cliente da instituição e este é seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mais cervejas, refrescos, vinho e outros. Os anteriores empréstimos foram de 8.500.00mt e 13.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o intuito de montar um negócio de avicultura.
texts.en:
Born in Zavala, district of Inhambane in the province of the same name, 46 year-old Armando Q. is married and the father of four children ages 27, 25, 12 and 10. His studies were interrupted in 8th Grade, when he had to fulfill his military service duties. He lives with his family at a rental house in Boane, and also supports his mother, who lives in Zavala, by regularly sending her money and groceries. He moved from Zavala to Boane with his family as a child, when his parents were looking for work and a better life. He has owned a grocery store for 18 years, and currently has three people working for him. His bestselling items are beer, wine and soda. He's learned about the business with his late father. He currently makes 7.000.00 mt per month, and always manages to put some money into a savings account at BIM (Commercial Bank of Mozambique). His wife has her own business of selling used clothes. He has had loans with SOCREMO in the past but stopped being a client a while back, for personal reasons. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend and this is the third time he's applying for a loan. He will use the 20.000.00mt to buy more beverages to sell. His previous loans were in the amount of 8.500.00mt and 13.000.00mt and also used to increase his stock. He expects to pay off his loan without a problem and plans to apply for more credit in the future, to start a poultry business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beer, wine and soda to sell at his store

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.pt:
Francisco Tomas M. nasceu em Manjacaze, Distrito da Província de Gaza, tem 52 anos de idade casado e pai de 5 filhos de 2, 4, 23, 25 e 27 anos de idade. Destes 3 já casaram e vivem em suas casas. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou mais por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com a família e sustenta também a sua mãe, enviando algum dinheiro.

Saiu de Manjacaze ainda jovem para ir cumprir com o serviço militar obrigatório, depois de desmobilizado decidiu fixar sua residência em Boane (em 1980) e afecto como guarda do Comité olímpico. 

Actualmente trabalha como guarda de uma empresa auferindo um salário mensal de 2.200.00mt e mais uma pensão de desmobilizado no valor de 4.200.00mt, assim consegue poupar algum no banco Comercial BIM todos os meses.

Já levantou empréstimos com outras instituições bancárias, (B. Consumo, Caixa Comunitária).
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos e este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, pedra, areia e outros materiais. Os seus empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.200.00mt e 15.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade.

O seu objectivo principal é de melhorar a sua residência para dar mais comodidade aos filhos, por isso no futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Born in Manjacaze, district of Gaza, 52 year-old Francisco Tomas M. is married and the father of five children ages 2, 4, 23, 25 and 27 (the three oldest are married). Due to his parents' financial difficulties, his studies were interrupted in 6th Grade. He lives with his family in a house they own. In addition to supporting his family, he also supports his mother, who lives elsewhere, by regularly sending her money. Francisco left Manjacaze to fulfill his military service duties. He moved to Boane in 1980, when he was demobilized from the military and found work as a guard supporting the Olympics committee. He currently works as a security guard at a private company, earning a monthly salary of 2.200.00mt in addition to the 4.200.00 he gets from his military pension. This allows him to put money, every month, into the savings account he has at BIM (Commercial Bank of Mozambique). Francisco has had loans with other credit institutions in the past. This is his third time applying for a loan with Hluvuku. He will use his 15.000.00mt to buy cement, stones, sand and other construction materials. His two previous loans, used for the same purpose, were in the amount of 10.200.00mt and 15.000.00mt. He plans to apply for additional credit in the future to achieve his goal of improving his house and making it more comfortable for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material (cement, sand, stones)

loans.name: Joshua's Group

texts.en: Joshua W. is 36 years old and married with three kids. He is the leader of his group in Mukono. Joshua would like to use this loan of 300,000 USH to expand his business and buy the proper supplies to begin sand quarrying.

loans.use: more construction supplies

loans.name: Maria Sofia

texts.pt:
Maria V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do país, tem 54 anos de idade casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 30, 32, e 34 anos de idade. Vive na casa própria com o marido e a sua neta, porque os filhos já são maiores de idade e tem residências próprias. Fez o nível médio trabalha como funcionário da Educação, o seu marido tem um negocio próprio e ajuda no sustento da família.

Nunca mudou de cidade e trabalha como professora a mais de 25 anos, formou se no Instituto de Magistério Primaria da Matola. Tem um rendimento mensal de 6.200.00mt com o qual sustenta apenas a sua família e ainda consegue poupar algum no final de mês através de sistema tradicional de poupança (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com as senhoras de mercado SANTOS e acompanharam ate a sucursal da Catembe. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cimento, areia e ferro. O empréstimo anterior também do mesmo valor e finalidade.

Tem como objectivos melhorar as condições da sua residência. No futuro pretender levantar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e construir uma capoera para criacao de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Maria V. was born in the city of Maputo, the country's capital, she is 54 years old and has 3 sons who are 30, 32 and 34 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and her granddaughter, because her sons are older now and have their own houses. She finished middle school and works in Education, her husband has a business and helps supporting the family. She never moved to another city and has been working as a teacher for the last 25 years, he studied at the Primary Magistrate of Matola. She earns 6,200MT monthly which is used to support her family and is able to save some money at the end of the month thru the traditional saving system (Xitique). She never requested a credit before from other banks, she learned about Hluvuku thru conversations with ladies at the market of Santos who accompanied her to the branch in Catembe. This is her 2nd loan with Hluvuku for 10,500MT which will be used to buy cement, sand and iron. The previous loan was for the same amount and for the same reason. Her goal is to improve the conditions of her residence. In the future she expects to request more loans to finish building her house and a fence to raise chicken.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and others)

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose K. is 35 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is divorced and cares not only for her own two children, but for several orphans as well. Rose has operated her own boutique for three years and generates profits of over 80,000 USH per week from it. One of the big challenges of her business is to stock appropriate amounts of clothing during periods of seasonal change.

Rose would like to use her loan of 300,000 USH to buy additional amounts of clothing. She believes that if she continues to work hard by offering fair prices and excellent levels of customer care her business will continue to grow and she will be able to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Elisa Gomes

texts.pt:
Elisa N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do Pais, tem 23 anos de idade casada e mãe de 1 filha de 6 meses de idade, vive com seu esposo na casa cedida pelos sogros. Fez 11ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. 

Saiu de Maputo com os pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços no ano de 2006 e foram fixar se em Boane, onde actualmente encontra se a residir com o seu marido e tem um negocio próprio. Trabalha com seu marido e tem 2 trabalhadores para ajudar na sua actividade comercial. Nesta actividade consegue um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mes e consegue poupar algum no Banco Comercial BIM. 

Nunca levantou empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu esposo que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 13.700.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros produtos, para aumentar o volume do negócio. Tem sido difícil vender no Inverno porque estes produtos têm pouca procura.

O grande objectivo neste momento é responder as necessidades de casa como alimentação, saúde, escola e outros. No futuro gostaria de aceder a mais empréstimos para construir a sua própria casa e fazer o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Elisa N. was born in Maputo, the country's capital, she is 23 years old, she is married and has 1 daughter who is 6 months old, she lives with her husband at her parents in law. She finished the 11th grade, and didn't finished school due to her pregnancy. She left Maputo with her parents were transferred back in 2006 and went to live in Boane, where she currently lives with her husband and has a business. She works with her husband and has 2 employees to help at the business. At the store she is able to obtain 15.000MT a month and is able to save some money at the Commercial Bank BIM. She never requested a loan at any other banks before, she learned about Hluvuku thru his husband who is client of the institution. This is her first loan for 13.700MT which will be used to buy beer, wine, other beverages and products, in order to increase the volume of her business. It has been difficult to sell during the winter because demand is low for those products during the season. The large objective is to answer the necessities of the house like health, food, studies and others. In the future she would like to access more loans to build their own house and attend college.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell groceries and beverages

loans.name: Sousa Manuel

texts.pt:
Elisa Ngazane nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do Pais, tem 23 anos de idade casada e mãe de 1 filha de 6 meses de idade, vive com seu esposo na casa cedida pelos sogros. Fez 11ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. 

Saiu de Maputo com os pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços no ano de 2006 e foram fixar se em Boane, onde actualmente encontra se a residir com o seu marido e tem um negocio próprio. Trabalha com seu marido e tem 2 trabalhadores para ajudar na sua actividade comercial. Nesta actividade consegue um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mes e consegue poupar algum no Banco Comercial BIM. 

Nunca levantou empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu esposo que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 13.700.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros produtos, para aumentar o volume do negócio. Tem sido difícil vender no Inverno porque estes produtos têm pouca procura.

O grande objectivo neste momento é responder as necessidades de casa como alimentação, saúde, escola e outros. No futuro gostaria de aceder a mais empréstimos para construir a sua própria casa e fazer o ensino superior.
texts.en:
Elisa Ngazane nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital do Pais, tem 23 anos de idade casada e mãe de 1 filha de 6 meses de idade, vive com seu esposo na casa cedida pelos sogros. Fez 11ª classe, não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Saiu de Maputo com os pais quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços no ano de 2006 e foram fixar se em Boane, onde actualmente encontra se a residir com o seu marido e tem um negocio próprio. Trabalha com seu marido e tem 2 trabalhadores para ajudar na sua actividade comercial. Nesta actividade consegue um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mes e consegue poupar algum no Banco Comercial BIM. Nunca levantou empréstimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu esposo que também é cliente da mesma instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 13.700.00mt com o qual pretende comprar cerveja, vinho, refrescos e outros produtos, para aumentar o volume do negócio. Tem sido difícil vender no Inverno porque estes produtos têm pouca procura. O grande objectivo neste momento é responder as necessidades de casa como alimentação, saúde, escola e outros. No futuro gostaria de aceder a mais empréstimos para construir a sua própria casa e fazer o ensino superior.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de tecidos para fazer roupa diversa

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
Babken H. is 22 years old. He lives in the village of Ddmashen near the town of Sevan with his parents and his two sisters. One sister is school-aged, and the other is jobless. Babken’s mother teaches biology in a Ddmashen school, and his father helps Babken in the business.

Babken studies in the Correspondence Courses at the Teachers-training College in Yerevan. Parallel to studying he has his own business, which consists of lavash (Armenian bread) production and sales. The bakery is in the family’s private house. Babken and his father have been running this business for five years, and they now employ a staff of two.

Babken needs US$ 3,000 for wholesale purchase of flour. Babken wants to use one part of the flour in his business and the other part he wants to resell. With the income for his business, Babken hopes to increase his sales and pay for his studies.

loans.use: For wholesale purchase of flour

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the welding business for the last 20 years and he operates his welding shop in Naivasha town.  

He is 50 years old, married and has four school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to buy a new welding machine with the proceeds of this loan.

In future, he sees himself operating a big workshop and also venturing into selling welding supplies.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy a new welding machine

loans.name: God Children Group

texts.en:
'God Children' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Martha K., 44 years old, married with 5 children aged 11-25 years old. Their educational levels are 5th grade-high school graduate. Martha is a 9th grade drop-out due to lack of financial support. She and her family live in Brewer Ville, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia .

Martha's business is baking bread. She buys baking materials like flour, sugar, butter, yeast, etc.  to bake bread to sell retail to residents of Brewer Ville. She has been running this business for 9 years and is hoping to establish a bigger bakery in the future.

Martha bakes good bread and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. But she faces difficulties like heat from the oven and price rises of baking materials. She needs this loan in order to purchase candles, rice, Maggi cubes etc. to sell along with her bread as a means of expanding the business. 

Martha dreams of improving the living standard for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase candles, rice, Maggi cubes etc. to sell along with her bread

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Rajabu S., age 25, is single with two older brothers and one younger brother.  He has a small business selling cassava and sweet potatoes. He opened the business in 2005 and works long daily hours from 5 am until 6:30 pm. By selling cassava and sweet potatoes both wholesale in bulk and in smaller amounts at a higher price he is able to earn a monthly profit of around $120.

This will be Rajabu’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to establish and grow his current cassava and sweet potato stand, and he has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes to use this loan to increase his stocks even more.
	
Rajabu belongs to the Loyola Group, which totals 24 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In the picture, Rajabu is sitting next to the man in white shirt on the right side.

loans.use: to increase the stock of cassava and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The client is a 33-year-old male, recently married, with no children. He makes doors, windows, partitions and similar things for businesses and residences out of aluminum parts that he buys from vendors in Iraq. The vendors bring these parts from neighboring Turkey. This is his third loan from Al-Thiqa. Eight years ago the client started this business in a small shop with just one employee. Al-Thiqa's loans helped him grow his business, and now he is the largest manufacturer of these products in the city, with three employees. He has a great reputation in the city for the quality of his products and services.

loans.use: To purchase parts

loans.name: God Creation Group

texts.en:
'God Creation' is a group of 5 borrowers led by Tonia T., 40 years old, married  with 2 children aged 18 and 21 years old; their educational levels are 8th and 11th grade. Tonia also cares for 2 siblings. She and her family live in Virginia, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy a town lots, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia .

Tonia's business is selling well-prepared food. She buys foodstuffs like rice, oil, Maggi cubes, vegetables, etc. to cook and sell by the plate to residents of Virginia, Liberia.She has been running this business for 2 years and is hoping to improve business in the future.


Tonia cooks delicious food that is affordable and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase bags of rice and palm oil. Tonia dreams of improving the living condition of her family and educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and palm oil

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Dismas C., age 27, is single.  He has a general store which he started in 2004. At the store, he sells rice, sugar, beans, and also items like cups and utensils. He works daily from 6am until 11pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $152. 

This will be Dismas’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his general store and has paid them back successfully.  He hopes for a new loan to increase the size of his business. 
	
Dismas will share this loan with his loan group, Bahari, which totals 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Dismas is 1st on the right, back row, with a red cap.

loans.use: increasing the stock of his general store

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is a widow. Her children have grown up and moved out. Katerina sells sewing thread at Farmer's market in Nikopol town. Katerina started this business 8 years ago. There have been almost no competitors in this kind of retail business. At the same time there is a stable demand.

Katerina would like to develop her business further and increase her client base. She would like to borrow 15,400 UAH to increase the assortment of goods she carries. Katerina was able to buy a small car recently that helps her in her business.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of goods she carries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more commodities for her shop.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 46 years old and the mother of five children. She is the leader of her group in Mukono and owns a farm where she grows a wide variety of produce including but not limited to, bananas, cassava, and sweet potatoes.

Sarah has been running her farm for 10 years and currently generates on average 80,000 USH per month in profits. She would like to use this loan to purchase more seed and fertilizer in order to increase crop yields. With persistence and continued hard work, she hopes to be able to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Djasmin

texts.en: Djasmin is married with 5 children.  Djasmin is a true entrepreneur.  She has been working in her field of selling small fish from Lake Kivu (3 hours drive from the capital city of Kigali) for 9 years.  The hours of operation for her business are 6AM - 630PM every day.  The business is doing quite well and employs a total of 4 other people.  The anticipated monthly profit for Djasmin's business is nearly 150,000 RWF (or roughly $US275).  This is not Djasmin's first loan from Vision Finance Company - she has had 7 loans previously - All fully paid.  Access to credit is critical for the proper functioning of any small enterprise and Djasmin's business is no exception.

loans.use: for purchasing more small fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cloth for her business

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence Nakaddu is the leader of her group in Makuno. She has five children of her own and also cares for two orphans. She has been involved in the charcoal business for four years and this is her first loan with Pearl. Recently sales have been lower than usual and she would like a loan so she may boost her business and maintain her levels of inventory.

With hard work and good management she hopes that her business will continue to remain profitable and that she will be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: more inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of clothes for her business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando is 37 years old and lives with his common-law wife and their four children. He owns a business producing milk and making soft cheese with it. He sells this cheese in two markets in the city of Cochabamba. Orlando has been working with livestock for five years now, ever since he inherited the first cow from his parents. After that, he bought each cow, one by one. Now, he produces an average of 40 rolls of soft cheese each day.

With this loan from Kiva partner CIDRE, Orlando will purchase more food for his livestock, such as soy husks and corn husks. This additional funding will help his cows produce more milk and thus increase his earnings. With the extra income, Orlando will purchase more materials for the construction of his home on a plot of land he inherited. He has worked as a bricklayer in the past, so he enjoys the tough work of constructing his home brick by brick. Orlando's family is currently living in an adobe home, so he looks forward to the sturdiness of the home he is now building. Orlando believes the extra earnings and the new home will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his livestock

loans.name: Grover

texts.en:
Grover is 24 years old, single, and lives in a small, humble home with his mother. He is a dairy cow farmer and spends his days tending to his livestock, which he has been doing for over 12 years now.

With this loan from Kiva partner CIDRE, Grover will invest in more cattle so he can produce a greater quantity of milk. With the extra income, Grover hopes that he can help his elderly mom and improve their standard of living. As he is his mother's only son, he had to leave his studies in order to help her tend to the difficult and laborious work on the farm.

In the future, he hopes to finish high school and build a career for himself. Above all, Grover wants to make sure that his elderly mother has enough money to be able to retire. He also hopes to help her expand her home, as a way of repaying her for all the help she has given him over the years.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for milk production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of maize and wheat for making local beer.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es pequeño agricultor de verduras y flores los cuales lo comercializa en la ciudad de La Paz; también se dedica a la producción de leche. Tiene dos hijos los cuales están el colegio su esposa colabora con los quehaceres de la casa. Vive en casa propia y esta ubicada en la comunidad de El Palomar de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para poder aumentar la producción de leche e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Jose.
texts.en:
Jose is a small farmer who grows vegetables and flowers to be are sold in the city of La Paz. He is also involved in milk production. Jose has two children who are in school. His wife collaborates in the household business. He lives in his own house, located in the community of El Palomar within the City of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy a medium quality milk cow, in order to augment milk production and increase the family's income. This is his first credit with IMPRO. An evaluation qualifies Jose for approval of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW TO INCREASE MILK PRODUCTION

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene es pequeño agricultor de verduras y flores los cuales  comercializa por mayor en la ciudad de La paz, la esposa se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa; tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad  su domicilio queda en la población de Palomar Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de semilla ya que por esta temporada empiezan los arados y sembradíos.
  
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rene.

loans.use: compra de semillas para su negocio de producción de flores y verduras.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania tiene un puesto donde vende verduras, su esposo es chofer de minibus, ellos tienen un terreno donde producen verduras y flores además tienen dos vacas, la leche que extraen la convierten en queso, tienen dos hijos los cuales están en colegio. Viven en casa propia que esta ubicada en la población de El Palomar de La Ciudad de La paz.
 
El crédito es para  compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, para aumentar su producción de leche para ser convertida en queso y vender más..
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Estefania.

loans.use: compra de una vaca lechera para conseguir más leche y así producir más queso para su venta.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 36 year single mother of four children aged between 14 and 20 years. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a one roomed house where she stays with five people  Harriet takes care of additional family members. The family has no access to electricity and piped water.  Harriet works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She sells in Kampala at Arua park stage in Kampala, city one the various bus stages in Uganda. Harriet buys sugar ant milk from nearby shops.  She pays transport costs to and from home. She is faced with the challenge of increasing prices of merchandise and city council authorities who no longer want them to operate in the city center   . Her monthly expenses include rent  feeding the the family and medication  .Harriet   sells to all categories of people both on retail and works seven days a week  She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more milk  and sacks of charcoal. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a whole sale shop.

loans.use: To buy more  milk and sugar  charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional stocks of commodities for her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel vive en la casa de sus Padres quienes le proporcionaron parte de su terreno ubicado en la calle Carmen Rodríguez  de la zona  Villa Ingenio, de la ciudad de El Alto.
Trabaja como arquitecto en una empresa constructora de caminos, su esposa se encarga de los cuidados de su hijo.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de materiales de construcción para las habitaciones que está construyendo en el terreno que le fue cedido por sus padres para que pueda independizarse con su esposa y su bebe de diez meses.
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Daniel.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para la construcción de un par de habitaciones y así poder vivir más confortablemente.

loans.name: Silvia Liliana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yanbal se formo en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que encierra mucho de la era colonial y moderna donde además podemos disfrutar de paisajes que resaltan su belleza andina tìpica del clima frió, su gente es  muy cálida y carismática como las socias que conforman  este banco que son un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a superarse día a día y salir adelante con sus familias y nunca ser derrotadas con los obstáculos que la vida les presenta.

La señora Silvia Liliana R. P. vive por la parroquia Ricaurte sector Santa Rosa a unos 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 35 años de edad está casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y  15 años,  su esposo trabaja como comerciante y es su  mayor apoyo en el hogar, aun no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa arrendada. 

Silvia vende comidas en las ferias  de Azogues y Cañar todos los fines de semana, lleva siete años trabajando en este negocio lo que le permite tener su clientela fija, además cuenta con un pequeño puesto de venta de calzado y ropa.

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con el banco comunal y nos comenta que los préstamos recibidos ha invertido en la compra de  mercadería y productos básicos para sus dos negocios y el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR  le entregue no va a ser la excepción pues va a invertir en la compra de zapatos y ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para seguir ampliando su negocio y tener un sotck suficiente para la época navideña.

Su mayor sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Yanbal Communal Bank formed in the city of Cuenca. It is a city that encompasses much from the colonial and modern eras. We are also able to enjoy its Andean beauty, which is typical of the cold climate. The people are very warm and charismatic like the members who comprise this bank. They are a group of women given to improving themselves day to day and to getting ahead with their families. They are never defeated by life’s obstacles. Silvia Liliana R. P. lives in the Ricuarte parrish in the Santa Rosa sector. It is 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. She is 35, married, and she has two children who are 16 and 15. Her husband works as a businessman, and he is her biggest support in the household. They do not yet have their own home, so they live in a rented house. Silvia sells food every week-end in the Azogues and Cañar fairs. She has been working in this business for seven years. It has allowed her to have regular customers. She also has a small stand where she sells footwear and clothing. This is her fourth cycle working with the communal bank. She tells us that she used the loans she has received to buy merchandise and basic products for her two businesses. This loan from the ESPOIR Foundation will not be the exception. She will buy shoes and clothing for women, men, and children in order to keep expanding her business and to have sufficient stock for the Christmas season. Her greatest dream is to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes and clothing for women, men, and children to increase her business

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.es:
El socio Wilbert, es natural de la provincia de Quillabamba, el pertenece al banco comunal,” Fuerza Compartida”, ubicado en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de huanchac.

Nuestro socio tiene 35 años de edad, el tiene 1 hijo y esta separado; el trabaja en comercio minorista, nuestro socio tiene un stand de venta de frutas, el socio trae de Quillabamba las frutas a la ciudad del Cusco, nuestro socio trabaja vendiendo frutas en el mercado mayorista virgen asunta, el socio es nuevo en este banco y recién está aprendiendo la mecánica de trabajo de bancos comunales. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en su mercadería, trayendo más frutas que de costumbre.

El socio agradece la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y de este modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Wilbert is a member of the communal bank "Fuerza Compartida," which is located in the city of Cusco in the Huanchac district. He is originally from the province of Quillabamba. He is 35 years old, and is separated with one son. He works in retail trade; he has a fruit business where he brings fruits from Quillabamba to the city of Cusco and sells the fruits in the wholesale market "Virgen Asunta." He is a new member of this bank, and is learning the mechanics of working with a communal bank. He needs a loan to invest in his merchandise, so that he can bring more fruit than usual. He is grateful for the opportunity that is provided through these means, and is committed to making the payments on his debt in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
El señor Juan José T. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en su anterior crédito el cual le ayudo ha construir la barda alrededor de su casa.
Nueva mente está solicitando su cooperación para este crédito. Ya que desea colocar las protecciones a su vivienda en las ventanas y puertas  y así darle más seguridad a su familia, cundo el ande trabajando ya que tiene hijos pequeños y quiere la seguridad para ellos.
Con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabaja como ayudante de soldador planea pagar nueva mente este crédito.

loans.use: Colocación de las protecciones

loans.name: Bernabé

texts.es:
El señor Bernabé H. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo comprar el material a un buen precio y su negocio ha crecido más.
Ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar más material ya que el que tenía ya se termino y quiere ir a la ciudad de Monterrey México a comprar por mayoreo y así no ir en todo el año.
Nuevamente espera su cooperación en este crédito y así su familia y negocio tendrá más ingresos, y con el cual pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Bernabe is very grateful for the cooperation he received on his previous loan, which enabled him to buy materials at a good price. And his business has grown even more.

He is requesting a new loan to buy more materials, since what he had is now used up. Bernabe wishes to go to the city of Monterrey, Mexico to buy enough at wholesale that he won't have to go again for the rest of the year.

He hopes for your renewed cooperation in this credit and, thus, his family and business will have more income with which he will pay off the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con KIVA y cuatro con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntual mente. Con estos préstamos  su negocio a crecido y le a invertido, también sus ingresos se han mejorado.
Nueva mente quiere invertir en comprar mercancía y una refrigerador para la venta de carnes, quesos, lactaos y verduras. 
Pero en este momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para la invenció y esta solicitando un nuevamente un crédito y es pera contar con su cooperación en esté nueva préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfredo Rodríguez has had two loans with Kiva and four with FVP. He has repaid them punctually. He invested in his business, and it has grown with these loans. Also, his income has improved. He wants to invest again and buy merchandise and a refrigerator to sell meat, cheese, dairy products, and vegetables. But, at this time he does not have the money necessary for this investment. He is asking for a new loan. He hopes to have your cooperation with this new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
El señor Ismael T. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pago puntual mente.
Está solicitando otro préstamo para nuevamente comprar más refacciones y partes para autos, ya que las que tenía se le terminaron y quiere tener inventario para sus clientes.
El desea contar nueva mente con su cooperación en esté crédito ya que su negocio a crecido gracias a estos préstamo que a tenido con ustedes.
Planea pagar esté crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Ismael T. is very grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan, which he repaid punctually. He is asking for another loan to buy more spare parts and parts for autos. The ones he had are gone, and he wants to have inventory for his customers. Once again he wishes to have your cooperation with this loan. His business has grown thanks to the other loans he has had with you. He plans to repay the loan with the income from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy spare parts and parts for cars to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: uso personal.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora María De Los Ángeles R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo, ya que necesita pagar el hospital donde están internando su papá que esta enfermo, Doña María De Los Ángeles no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar la atención y los medicamentos que su padre necesita para aliviarse es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación para poder pegar el hospital y el medicamento.
Ella planea pagar este crédito con su pensión que recibe y los gastos familiares serán con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
María De Los Ángeles R. is very grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan, which she used to stock her business. Once again she is asking for a loan because she needs to pay the hospital her father is in. Her father is sick. María De Los Ángeles does not have the money needed to pay for his care and the medication he needs. That is why she is asking for your help to be able to pay the hospital and for the medication. She plans to repay this loan with his pension. She will pay family expenses with income from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay her father's medical expenses

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
El señor José Manuel O. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual el pudo ayudar a su papá con el tratamiento que necesita ya esta mucho mejor y se esta tratando su enfermedad.
Nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo y este será para darle mas seguridad a su familia ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de la casa y por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita nuevamente su cooperación para este préstamo y así su familia va estar mas segura cundo el este trabajando.
La persona que aparece en la foto es su hijo el mayor ya que cuando fuimos a realizar la visita el señor José Manuel y sus esposa la señora Laura Navarro no se encontraban en la casa, fueron  por lo otros niños a la escuela es por eso quien nos atendió fue su hijo.

loans.use: Elaboración de la barda alrededor de la casa

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia E. esta muy agradecida con su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual le servio mucho para surtirlo.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para pagarles a los proveedores ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar y desea nueva mente surtir el negocio de otra variedad de productos como es de carnes frías, lácteos, frutas y verduras, que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo que venda estos productos.
Doña Natalia planea pagar este nuevo préstamo con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Natalia E. is very grateful for your cooperation with the previous loan, which she used to buy stock. She is asking for a loan again to pay the providers. At this time she does not have the money, and she wants to stock her business with another variety of products like cold meats, dairy products, fruits, and vegetables. Her customers are asking her to sell these products. Natalia plans to repay this new loan with earnings from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay the providers and buy more merchandise

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia A. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo surtir su negocio.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar más mercancía ya que la que tenía se le fue terminando, y ahora quiere compara ropa de invierno. 
Planea pagar le crédito con los ingresos del negocio, ya que sus gastos familiares los cubre del sueldo que percibe de su empleo de limpieza de una casa particular.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía para el negocio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: uso personal

loans.name: Ruth Marlene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yanbal se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que encierra mucho de la era colonial y moderna donde además podemos disfrutar de paisajes que resaltan su belelza andina típica del clima frío, su gente es muy cálida y carismática como las socias que conforman este banco  que son un grupo de mujeres dispuestas a superarse día a dia y  salir adelante con sus familias y nunca ser derrotadas con los obstáculos que la vida les presenta.

La señora  Rut Marlene Sánchez Gómez vive en la parroquia de Balzay en la  ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 22, 18, 8 años de edad  que no son reconocidos por el padre, su primer hijo ya trabaja y el dinero que obtiene es sólo para sus gastos personales mientras que sus otros dos hijos son estudiantes de secundaria y primaria, hace incapié que sola ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos y que aún no tienen casa propia pero viven en casa de su madre.

Rut trabaja arreglando ropa y confeccionando  delantales que los vende en las ferias de la ciudad, lleva veinte años ejerciendo esta actividad y nos cuenta que gracias a Dios  le va muy bien, también se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva legumbres, hortalizas y algunas frutas tanto para el consumo de su hogar como para la venta.

Este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación y nos cuenta que le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realizó en la FUNDACION ESPOIR  lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para seguir confeccionando sus delantales y comprar semillas para cultivar otros productos e incrementar sus huertos.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Yanbal was formed in the city of Cuenca, a city that incorporates both colonial and modern elements, where one also can enjoy landscapes that highlight the beauty that is typical of the high Andes. Its people are very warm and charismatic, as are the members that comprise this communal bank, a group of women who are willing to better themselves day by day and get ahead with their families, never being defeated by the obstacles that life presents. Señora Ruth Marlene Sánchez Gómez lives in the parish of Balzay in the city of Cuenca. She is 43 years old and is a single mother of three children who are 22, 18 and 8 years old and who are not recognized by their father. Her oldest son already works and the money he earns covers his personal expenses, while the other two children are students in secondary and primary school. She emphasizes that on her own she has succeeded in getting ahead with her children. She does not yet have her own home, but she and her family live in her mother's house. Ruth works mending clothes and making aprons that she sells in the markets of the city. She has been doing this for 20 years, and she tells us that thanks to God it is going very well. She also works in agriculture cultivating vegetables and fruits, as much to consume in the house, as well as to sell. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation, and she tells us that her business has benefited. With this new loan from Fundacion ESPOIR, she will buy fabric to continue making aprons, and will buy seeds to cultivate other products and increase her gardens. Her dream is to have her own home. .

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make aprons, and to buy seeds to increase her gardens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar materiales quirurgicos.

loans.name: Toulassi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis que son mari a eu sa retraite, il est difficile pour le couple d’assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants ; c’est pour cette raison que cette dame s’est lancée en 2002 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale devant sa maison dans le quartier de Bè Kamalado à Lomé. Avec cette activité, elle arrive à apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Son voisinage apprécie en tout temps le bon accueil qu’elle a toujours su réserver à tous ses clients. Elle compte dans l’avenir agrandir plus son commerce en vendant de l’eau minérale, de l’eau de javel et des savons en poudre pour la lessive. Mais en ce moment elle a un besoin urgent de renouveler son stock ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de sardines, 10 cartons de tomates en boîte, 15 cartons de pâtes alimentaires macaroni.

loans.use: Achat des produitrs d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: enfermera.

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el ayudo a surtir su negocio y tener más variedad de productos.
Pero se le ha terminado la mercancía y por eso esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo y así surtir su negocio de mercancía. 
Ya que es la fuente de ingresos de sus hijos ya que es viuda y solo cuenta con su negocio. Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía

loans.name: Esmerita Margarita

texts.es:
La señora ESMERITA MARGARITA B. V., tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios técnicos de confección de ropa interior para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 meses de edad quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
ESMERITA se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa interior para niños, jóvenes y adultos.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300 soles, el cual utilizará para comprar algodón, elástico, encaje, etc. para la fabricación de ropa interior.
La empresaria sueña en confeccionar y vender lencería al por mayor, también tiene pensado estudiar para confeccionar buzos, pero esta esperando que su bebe crezca un poco mas para así poder empezar a estudiar.
texts.en:
Esmerita Margarita Briceño V., 25, lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres Valerosas Communal Bank. This businesswoman has a technical education in making underwear for children, youths, and adults. She is married and has two children. The children are four and three months old, and they are economically dependent upon her. Esmerita makes and sells underwear for children, youths, and adults. This is her first loan. She needs 300 PEN to buy cotton, elastic, and lace, etc. to make underwear. This businesswoman dreams of making and selling wholesale lingerie. She is also thinking of studying how to make sportswear, but she is waiting until her baby grows a little more to be able to begin studying.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: By cotton, elastic, and lace, etc.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée à un Directeur d’école ; le couple a 03 enfants. Grâce à l’aide de son mari, elle a pu constituer un fonds de commerce et s’est lancée dans la vente de pagne. Elle exerce cette activité de manière ambulante dans le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa volonté de réussite, elle arrive à bien s’en sortir et fidéliser sa clientèle. Beaucoup de femmes achètent chez elle des pagnes sur commande ; c’est pourquoi elle se déplace parfois dans les différents services pour livrer sa marchandise. En ce moment, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour renouveler son stock complètement en baisse ; ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter 15 pagnes Super Wax, 15 pagnes Hitarget et 25 pagnes Soso. Elle a une ferme volonté de rembourser son crédit dans les délais qui lui seront exigés.

loans.use: Achat de pagnes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita R. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mete, ahora está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para los acabados del interior y remodelar el baño de su casa.
Ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Quien se encarga de los ingresos de la familia es su esposo el señor Samuel Mendoza, quien trabaja en una compañía de trasportes en el departamento de chofer de carga, con una parte del ingreso planean pagar esté crédito, ya que desean que su hijo tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Margarita R. has already had two loans with FVP, which she has paid punctually. Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva to finish her home's exterior and remodel her home's bathroom.

Right now, she does not have the capital she needs to buy materials and pay the person who will be in charge of making these improvements. Her husband, Samuel Mendoza, is in charge of the family's income. He works for a transportation company as a load driver. They plan to repay this loan with part of his income, since they want their son to have a higher quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing their home's exterior and remodeling their bathroom

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La señora MARIA JUANA V. D. M. , tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito D. Trujillo, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to D. Secundaria.  Es casada  y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores quienes la apoyan económicamente y están atentos a ella.
MARIA se dedica a la confección y venta D. calzado para niñas.
Actualmente se encuentra fabricando pedidos para  eventos especiales como: Promociones, Primera comunión, Navidad, etc.
Los fabrica con el apoyo D. su esposo y los venD. con el apoyo D. su hijo quien viaja hasta Tumbes y Bagua a vender el calzado.
El primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra D. cuero y pegamento para la fabricación del calzado.
Este crédito D. 1,200 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra D. más material como: cuero, hilos, plantillas, dulopio, etc.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas y empezar a vender al por mayor en cuidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Juana V. D. M. is 54 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas” (Courageous Women). Maria completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She is married and has two adult children who already support her financially and attend to her needs.

Maria manufactures and sells footwear for girls. She currently fulfills orders for special events such as school promotions, first communions, Christmas, etc. Her husband assists her with making the shoes while her son helps her when she travels to Tumbes and Bagua to sell her goods.

Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase leather and adhesives for making shoes. This current loan of 1200 soles will be used to buy more materials such as leather, thread, insoles, foam rubber, etc. Maria dreams of increasing her sales and becoming a wholesaler in the nearby cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Essohouna

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un enseignant d’une école privée. Il n’est pas marié et n’a pas non plus d’enfant à sa charge. Il a de très grandes ambitions pour son avenir ; c’est pour cette raison que l’année dernière, il a ouvert, parallèlement à son métier d’enseignant, une cabine cellulaire pour disposer de plus de revenus. Il a recruté pour cela une jeune fille dans la gestion de la cabine. Actuellement il a besoin de s’approvisionner en cartes de recharge cellulaires ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour l’achat de cartes de recharges cellulaires Togocel et Moov. Il compte sur son sens des affaires pour le remboursement à temps du prêt.

loans.use: Achat de cartes de recharges cellulaires

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La señora MARCELINA B. B. , tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS. La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria. Es viuda desde hace 8 años  y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales a 2 apoya económicamente ayudándolos  que abran su propio negocio.
MARCELINA se dedica a la compra y venta de menestras como papas, yucas, harinas que trae de la sierra y los vende al por mayor.
También es socia de su hermano con quien compran madera la por mayor.
Actualmente se encuentra delicada de salud porque hace 1 mes se cayo de las escaleras ocasionándole una hematoma en la pierna izquierda por lo cual no a podido viajar a traer su mercadería pero refiere que el 15 del presente mes viajara a traer su mercadería.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de sacos de chocho y harinas.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará en la compra de menestras, chocho, harinas, etc.
La empresaria sueña con aumentar sus ventas, empezar a vender al por mayor para así generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcelina B. Briceño is 52 years old and lives in the District of Trujillo, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Valerosas” (Courageous Women). Marcelina completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has been a widow for 8 years and has 5 children, of whom 2 she support financially by helping them start their own businesses. Marcelina buys and sells dried vegetables such as potatoes and cassava, as well as flour. She brings her products from the mountains and then sells them wholesale. Her sister is also a Communal Bank member and sells wood wholesale. Marcelina is currently in fragile health because she fell from the stairs a month ago, causing a hematoma in her left leg. As a result, she is not able to travel in order to acquire her products for resale. Her next trip is scheduled for the 15th of the month. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase sacks of flour and candy. Marcelina is requesting another loan of 800 soles to buy dried vegetables, candy, flour, and other items. She dreams of increasing her sales and becoming a wholesale vendor so that she can generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried vegetables, candy, flour, and other items

loans.name: Las Palmeras Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Palmeras” esta  representado por la señora Viviana Rocío es un grupo que aperas de ser su primer ciclo ha demostrado responsabilidad en cada una de sus reuniones previas. Todas las socias son muy dinámicas y siempre buscan nuevos negocios para poder llevar el pan de cada día a sus hogares; un gran mayoría se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos como la venta de cosméticos, comida, refrescos, empanadas, celulares y ropa interior de forma ambulante. La competencia es amplia en el mercado por lo que las socias requieren de un mayor capital para la adquisición de mercadería para poder vender a más bajos precios y poder así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de sus familias. A pesar de ser su primer ciclo las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos con otras instituciones; por lo que conocen la modalidad de trabajo y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones de forma puntual.
texts.en:
The Las Palmeras group is represented by Viviana Rocío. This group has just started its first cycle, and it has demonstrated responsibility in each of its previous meetings. All of the members are very dynamic. They are always looking for new businesses to be able to bring home their daily bread. The majority of them are street vendors who sell different products like cosmetics, food, soft drinks, empanadas, cell phones, and underwear. There is a lot of competition in the market. The members need more capital to get merchandise to be able to sell at lower prices and improve their income and the quality of life of their families. Even though this is their first cycle, the members have experience with supportive groups thank to financing with other institutions. Therefore, they know the way it works and how to meet their obligations in a punctual manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Quamvi Amétépé

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer, il a ouvert en 2003 dans le quartier d’Attikpa à Lomé une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale, dans laquelle il vend aussi certains produits de beauté pour femmes. Cet homme est plein de dynamisme et a une passion pour ce commerce. Beaucoup de ses clients apprécient le bon accueil et le sourire avec lesquels il les accueille. Il approvisionne presque tout son voisinage. Il souhaite en ce moment renouveler son stock ; pour cela il voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de savons en poudre pour la lessive, 15 cartons de savons de toilettes, 05 cartons de pâtes dentifrices, 20 cartons de tomates en boîtes et bien d’autres produits indispensables pour son commerce.
texts.en:
This man is marrid and he has 2 children in his care. In order to fill the needs of his household, in 2003 he opened a general food store in the Attikpa district of Lome. There he also sells certain beauty products for women. This man is full of energy and he has a passion for his business. His clients appreciate the good customer service and the smile with which he serves them. He supplies to almost his entire neighborhood. Currently he wants to resupply his stocks. For this he would like to have a loan from Wages (Kiva Field Partner) in order to purchase 15 boxes of powdered laundry soap, 15 boxes of bath soaps, 5 cartons of toothpaste, 20 cartons of boxes tomatoes, as well as other daily use products for his business.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food items.

loans.name: El Tajibo Group

texts.es: El grupo “El Tajibo” esta representado por la señora Rebeca Marcela y conformado por 12 miembros  que residen en la misma localidad el tajibo cerca a Okinawa  es un grupo nuevo u bien integrado y con ganas D. salir adelante. Cada uno D. sus miembros tiene sus negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, cosméticos a la construcción D. viviendas, pero principalmente a la elaboración y distribución D. pan. La competencia es amplia en el mercado por lo que las socias requieren D. un mayor capital para la adquisición D. mercadería para poder vender a más bajos precios y poder así mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. sus familias. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo las socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos con otras instituciones; por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo y saben como cumplir con sus obligaciones D. forma puntual.
texts.en:
Rebeca Marcela represents the El Tajibo group, which is comprised of 12 members who live in El Tajibo near Okinawa. It is a well formed, new group with the desire to get ahead. Each one of the members has a business like selling groceries, cosmetics, or building houses. Their primary business is making and distributing bread. This is a lot of competition in the market. The members need more capital to acquire merchandise to be able to sell at lower prices and improve their income and the quality of life of their families. Even though this is their first cycle, the members have experience with supportive groups thank to financing with other institutions. Therefore, they know the way it works and how to meet their obligations in a punctual manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Dede G.

texts.fr: Cette dame a ouvert l’année dernière dans le quartier de Forever à Lomé une boutique d’alimentation générale, très visitée de beaucoup de personnes. C’est une boutique dans la quelle les produits en vente sont bien ordonnés et arrangés. Elle accueille toujours bien sa clientèle et compte de nombreux clients fidèles dans le quartier. Elle-même habite le quartier d’Agbalépédogan à Lomé, pourtant situé à quelques kilomètres de Forever où se trouve sa boutique. Elle a fait ce choix à cause du bon emplacement de cette boutique, où elle réalise à cet effet de bonnes affaires. Elle dispose un rayon spécial pour les boissons alcoolisées de bonne qualité. Elle sollicite urgemment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter différents cartons de boissons alcoolisées mais aussi des cartons de savons de toilettes, des papiers hygiéniques et bien d’autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: S. Jorge Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Jorge” esta representado por la señora Leidy Cecilia e  integrada por 12 miembros D. los cuales 9 son mujeres y 3 varones. En general los socios se dedican a la comercialización D. diferentes productos como ser  la venta D. comida rápida, empanadas, ropa, lubricantes y a la prestación D. servicios como empleadas, secretariado, educadoras y al servicio D. transporte público; la mayoría D. los socios trabaja en su domicilio o D. forma ambúlate en inmediaciones D. su barrio por lo que no tienen mucha competencia pero si desean agrandar sus negocios para poder dar a sus clientes una mayor comodidad y una mejor atención es por esta razón que se requiere el préstamo para poder utilizar los fondos en compras D. muebles para sus negocios, mercadería para su venta, insumos para su producción y herramientas que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas eficiente. En cuanto a la experiencia muchas D. las socias no cuenta con experiencia en créditos solidarios pero están muy entusiasmadas por recibir la confianza D. una institución que las apoya y cree en que puedan salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The group "San Jorge" is represented by Mrs. Leidy Cecilia and is maD. up of 12 members, of which 9 are women and 3 are men. In general, the partners make a living marketing different products, such as fast food, empanadas, clothes, and lubricants, and some work in other services, as clerks, secretaries, educators, and public transportation employees. The majority of the partners work in their home or travel around their neighborhood, therefore they do not have a lot of competition. However, they desire to enlarge their businesses to be able to give their clients greater comfort and better attention, and therefore require the loan, to utilize the funds in the purchase of furniture for their businesses, merchandise for sale, materials for production, and tools to help them perform more efficient work. In regards to experience, many of the partners have no experience with credit, but they are very enthusiastic about receiving the confidence of an institution that supports them and believes they can get ahead with their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es: El  grupo “Bolivia” esta representado por la señora Peregrina e integrada por 12 miembros muy dinámicos y con ganas D. salir adelante y crecer en sus pequeños negocios. Cada una D. sus integrantes tienen su negocio como por ejemplo la presidenta tiene su pequeño expendio D. comida con pensionistas diarios, los socios se dedican a actividades como albañilería, tornería y al transporte D. pasajeros, todas las socias restante se dedican a la elaboración, distribución y venta D. pan casero e industrial. La competencia en este rubro es alta pero también la demanda D. pan es alta por lo que las socias ya cuentan con tiendas que compran sus productos todos los días, pero el mercado y la demanda han crecido tanto que la capacidad D. producción no abastece es por esta razón que desean el crédito para adquisición D. herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto terminado en menor tiempo y por supuesto también se invertirá en la compra D. insumos como harina y otros. En cuanto a la experiencia muchas D. las socias no cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios pero están muy entusiasmadas por recibir la confianza D. una institución que las apoya y cree en que puedan salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The "Bolivia" group is represented by Mrs. Peregrina and consists of 12 members who are very active and eager to succeed and grow their small businesses. Each of its members have their own business such as the president who has a small food outlet with daily clients. Members engage in activities such as masonry, lathing and the transport of passengers. All the other members are engaged in processing, distribution and sale of commercial and homemaD. bread.
